pandora: <entryFree id="n33622" type="main" key="Pando_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n33622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Pandoras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 19</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*pandw/ra</foreign>, gifted by all</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the first woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made by Vulcan at Jupiter's command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and presented with gifts by all the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Epimetheus and mother of Pyrrha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 142" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 142</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandora Hesiodi, of a work executed by several hands,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pandorius: <entryFree id="n33623" type="main" key="pando_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandōrĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. pandura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 20, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
pandosia: <entryFree id="n33624" type="main" key="Pando_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandōsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pandwsi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n33624.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Acheron</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33624.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the Bruttians</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Mendocino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandrosos: <entryFree id="n33625" type="main" key="Pandro^sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandrŏsos</orth>, i. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ndrosos</foreign>, <sense id="n33625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Cecrops and sister of Aglauros and Herse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 738</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandura: <entryFree id="n33626" type="greek" key="pandu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pandou=ra</foreign>, <sense id="n33626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical instrument of three strings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invented by Pan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircipedem (i. e. Pana) pandura ... Faunum tibia decuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 924</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandurizo: <entryFree id="n33627" type="main" key="pandu_rizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūrizo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pandura</etym>, <sense id="n33627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play the</hi> pandura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandus: <entryFree id="n33628" type="main" key="pandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. pando</etym>, <sense id="n33628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: curvus, uncus): carina, Enn. ap. Vet. Schol. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 558</bibl> (Ann. v. 560 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G 2, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami, Ov M. 14, 660: juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am 1, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae pandis cornibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PANG" /> rostrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 713</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus,</quote> <trans><tr>crook-backed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:A. 1:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pandā urceus ansā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:106:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 106, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:277" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 277</bibl>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem nigrum et macrum et pandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus et pinus habentes umoris abundantiam in operibus solent esse pandae,</quote> <trans><tr>to warp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33628.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinius Pandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pane: <entryFree id="n33629" type="main" key="pa_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. panis.</entryFree>
panegyricus: <entryFree id="n33630" type="greek" key="pa^ne_gy^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">panhguriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a public assembly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">festival;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgy-rĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival oration of Isocrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which he eulogized the Athenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33630.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">praising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eulogistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <trans><tr>panegyrics</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a eulogy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panegyric</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam malos panegyricis mendacibus adulantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panegyrista: <entryFree id="n33631" type="greek" key="pa^ne_gy^rista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgyrista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">panhguristh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a eulogist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panegyrist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paneros: <entryFree id="n33632" type="greek" key="pa^ne^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănĕrastos</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pane/rws</foreign>, <sense id="n33632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposed to have the property of making fruitful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33632.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănĕros</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a slavename</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fr. Arv. p. 631.</sense></entryFree>
pangaeus: <entryFree id="n33633" type="main" key="Pangaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pangaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pangaea</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ggaion o)/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n33633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Philippi</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pilaf Tepeh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mons Pangaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flerunt Rhodopeiae arces Altaque Pangaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 462</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 679</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33633.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pangaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pangœan;</hi> also for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi> (late <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:73" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:631" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:575" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 575</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pango: <entryFree id="n33634" type="main" key="pango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pango</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, and pēgi or pĕpĭgi, pactum</itype> (v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 474 sq.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root pac-; Sanscr. pāca, band, fetter; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ph/gnumi</foreign>, fix; <foreign lang="greek">pa/xnh</foreign>, frost; <foreign lang="greek">pa/ssalos</foreign>, peg, etc.; cf.: pagus, pagina, paciscor; old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">paco</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pago</orth>; cf.: rem ubipacunt, XII.Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 894</bibl> P.</etym>, <sense id="n33634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix; to drive in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink in</hi> (syn.: figo, configo). </sense><sense id="n33634.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pangere, figere; <cit><quote lang="la">unde plantae pangi dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; v. clavus: tonsillam pegi laevo in litore, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v tonsilla, p. 356 Müll.; Col. poët. 10, 252; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33634.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ramulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicena millia malleolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: lactucam <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleam olearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.: filios,</quote> <trans><tr>to beget children</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33634.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse seram vites pangamque ex ordine colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiaria malleolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33634.6" n="A" level="2"> Versus carmina or facta (like componere), <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>: hic vostrum panxit maxuma facta patrum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl> (Epigr. v. 2 Vahl. p. 162; <cit><quote lang="la">but the verse: horrida Romuleum certamina pango duellum, is spurious): carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus de rerum naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid Sophocleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">a)ne/kdota</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pangendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pangendo nihil fieri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.7" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prima per artem temptamenta tui pepigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi> (class., but only in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> forms; for the <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> pacisci was used; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 10 sq.</bibl>: paciscor facit et pepigi et pactus sum, Serv. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 144</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paciscor, stipulor, despondeo): ducentis Philippis rem pepigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactam rem habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terminos, quos Socrates pepigerit (al. pegerit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 37</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis pepigerit ne illo (medicamento) usquam postea uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem nobiscum pepigistis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducias pepigisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit armillas tanti pepigisse Sabinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resumere libertatem occultis insidiis pepigerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui pretium pepigerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 42</bibl></cit>. —Freq. of a marriage contract, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledge</hi>, etc.: habeon' pactam (Sororem)?<cb n="PANI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pepigere viri, pepigerunt ante parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te peto quam lecto pepigit Venus aurea nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: haec mihi se pepigit; <cit><quote lang="la">pater hanc tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:20:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pangonius: <entryFree id="n33635" type="greek" key="pango_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pangōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pangōnus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paggw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n33635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panhormus: <entryFree id="n33636" type="main" key="Pa^nhormus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănhormus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănhormĭtā-nus</orth>, v. Panormus.</entryFree>
panicellus: <entryFree id="n33637" type="main" key="pa_ni^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panis</etym>, <sense id="n33637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little loaf</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paniceus: <entryFree id="n33638" type="main" key="pa_ni^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of bread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>huge loaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 257</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pānĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Breadville</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est Paniceis, milites panicei (a comic expression),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panicium: <entryFree id="n33639" type="main" key="pa_ni^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33639.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing baked</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cakes</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33639.1" n="II" level="1"> = panicum, <hi rend="ital">Italian panic-grass</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 3</bibl> ad Sev.; Edict. Diocl. p. 27; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panicoctarius: <entryFree id="n33640" type="main" key="pa_ni^cocta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcoctārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paniscoquo</etym>, <sense id="n33640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bread-making</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panicula: <entryFree id="n33641" type="main" key="pa_ni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcŭla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pānŭcŭla</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.; and contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pānŭcla</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 22</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panus</etym>, <sense id="n33641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tuft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a panicle</hi> on plants. </sense><sense id="n33641.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tu legiones difflavisti spiritu, quasi ventus folia aut paniculum tectorium, <hi rend="ital">a tuft of thatch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of reeds used for thatching</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecula rosa convolutis foliorum paniculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panicum a paniculis dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33641.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 82" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paniculus: <entryFree id="n33642" type="main" key="pa_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. panicula.</entryFree>
panicum: <entryFree id="n33643" type="main" key="pa_ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Italian panic-grass</hi>: panicum Italicum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panifex: <entryFree id="n33644" type="main" key="pa_ni^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>panis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n33644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breadmaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; cf.: panifex, <foreign lang="greek">a)rtopoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
panifica: <entryFree id="n33645" type="main" key="pa_ni^fi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female baker; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panificium: <entryFree id="n33646" type="main" key="pa_ni^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭfĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pānĕf-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the making of bread.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pane et faciendo panificium coeptum dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 105</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n33646.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing baked</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cakes</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenas coronasque et panificia libertus obtulisse ei visus est,</quote> <trans><tr>offering-cakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panion: <entryFree id="n33647" type="main" key="pa_ni_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānīon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> satyrion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panionius: <entryFree id="n33648" type="main" key="Pa^ni^o_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paniw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n33648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to all Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to all Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Panionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio omnibus Ionibus sacra et ideo Panionia appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33648.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănĭōnĭum</orth>, ii. <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. regio Panionia: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi est Panionium, sacra regio, et ob id eo nomine appellata, quod eam communiter Iones colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panis: <entryFree id="n33649" type="main" key="pa_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n33649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pāne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 12</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 69</bibl> and 114 P.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: non item apud vos est positum hoc pane et hic panis? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>, panium, acc. to Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 69</bibl> and 114 P.; panuin, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 771</bibl> P.) [from the root pa, to feed; whence also <foreign lang="greek">pa/omai</foreign>, pabulum, and pasco], <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loaf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc farinam aquā sparsit et assiduā tractatione perdomuit finxitque panem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pistore panem petimus, vinum ex oenopolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt ventris stabilimenta: pane et arsā bubulā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu rogas, Purpureum panem an puniceum soleam ego esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis rubidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: cibarius panis, <hi rend="ital">coarse bread</hi> (v. cibarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus,</quote> <trans><tr>black bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durus ac sordidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccus,</quote> <trans><tr>dry bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 83:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 83, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis plebeius, siligneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 119:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 119, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">panis tener et niveus mollique siligine factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus aut nauticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fermentatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">azymus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subcinericus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: mollia panis, <hi rend="ital">the crumb</hi>, Plin. <pb n="1298" /> <cb n="PANN" /> 13, 12, 26, § <cit><quote lang="la">82: panis crusta,</quote> <trans><tr>the crust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucella panis,</quote> <trans><tr>a mouthful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucida caerulei panis consumere frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33649.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a loaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comesse panem tres pedes latum potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bini panes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc effectos panes, jaciebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes et opsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes quos coxerat tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tortam panis unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 29, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque panes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esuriente panem suum dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:51" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frange esurienti panem tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 58, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33649.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33649.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Food</hi> in general: <cit><quote lang="la">non in solo pane vivit homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,014:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Thess. 3, 12</bibl>; and trop. of <hi rend="ital">food for the soul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritual nourishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum panis vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>the food which gives life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 6, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 51</bibl>, etc.—</sense><sense id="n33649.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mass in the shape of a loaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut panes viridantis aphronitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:37" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paniscus: <entryFree id="n33650" type="main" key="Pa_niscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāniscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pani/skos</foreign>. <sense id="n33650.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little Pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rural deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Nymphae, Panisci etiam et Satyri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33650.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 172, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannarius: <entryFree id="n33651" type="main" key="panna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pannus</etym>, <sense id="n33651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to cloth; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pannāria</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">presents of cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panneus: <entryFree id="n33652" type="gloss" key="panne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ragged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattered</hi>: panneus, <foreign lang="greek">r(a/kinos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pannicula: <entryFree id="n33653" type="main" key="panni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannĭcŭla</orth>, v. panicula.</entryFree>
pannicularius: <entryFree id="n33654" type="main" key="panni^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>panniculus</etym>, <sense id="n33654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rags</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tatters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannicularia causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pannĭcŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rags</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tatters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ragged clothes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panniculus: <entryFree id="n33655" type="main" key="panni^cu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pannus</etym>, <sense id="n33655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece of cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rag</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panniculus bombycinus,</quote> <trans><tr>a light</tr>, <tr>short garment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:258" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 258</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33655.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannĭ-cŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a mime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:72:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 72, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:86:3" default="NO">3, 86, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:61:12" default="NO">5, 61, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n33656" type="main" key="panni^cu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannĭcŭlus</orth>, v. panicula.</entryFree>
pannonia: <entryFree id="n33657" type="main" key="Panno^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pannoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country lying between Dacia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Noricum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:225" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 225</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n33657.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannŏnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pannonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">augures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33657.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pannonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cattae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:69:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pannonicae stirpis canes, Nemes, Cyn. 126: pilei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33657.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pannonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pannonis ursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 220</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33657.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pannonian; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pannŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Pannonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallax Pannonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:109" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 78</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 2, 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannositas: <entryFree id="n33658" type="main" key="panno_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pannosus</etym>, <sense id="n33658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raggedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flabbiness</hi>: cutis veluti ruginosa vel sulcata pannositas, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">r(a/kwsin</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:86" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannosus: <entryFree id="n33659" type="main" key="panno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pannus</etym>, <sense id="n33659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rags</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ragged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattered.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33659.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:5" default="NO">21, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33659.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33659.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rag-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:72:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 72, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex aceti,</quote> <trans><tr>that looks like rags</tr>, <tr>mothery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:32" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33659.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ragged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 148, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pannuceatus: <entryFree id="n33660" type="main" key="pannu_ce^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannūcĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pannuceus</etym>, <sense id="n33660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ragged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pannuceati,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a comedy of Pomponius</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 22</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
pannuceus: <entryFree id="n33661" type="main" key="pannu_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannūcĕus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pannūcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pannus</etym>, <sense id="n33661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ragged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattered.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33661.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pannūcĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rags</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33661.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flabby</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">māla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>; Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:46:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 46, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannulus: <entryFree id="n33662" type="main" key="pannu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece of cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rag</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33662.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pannŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rags</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ragged clothes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannuncularia: <entryFree id="n33663" type="gloss" key="pannuncu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannuncŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. pannicularia (v. pannicularius): <sense id="n33663.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">pannus, pannunculus, pannuncularia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pannunculus: <entryFree id="n33664" type="gloss" key="pannuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. panniculus; <sense id="n33664.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
pannus: <entryFree id="n33665" type="main" key="pannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n33665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pannum</orth>,<cb n="PANT" />  i, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 27</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> pannibus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 40</bibl> P.; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 32</bibl>) [<foreign lang="greek">ph=nos</foreign>; Dor. <foreign lang="greek">pa=nos</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">a cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a garment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">albo Fides Velata panno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus viridis panni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 198</bibl></cit>. —Esp. of torn, worn-out clothes, <hi rend="ital">rags</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tatters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannis annisque obsitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara in tenui facundia panno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33665.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33665.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rag</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus et alter Adsuitur pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membraque vinxerunt tinctis ferrugine pannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:235" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panno rubro fugare armentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:202" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 202</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33665.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A head-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fillet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, n. 5 <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 6, 2, n. 7.—</sense><sense id="n33665.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satchel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33665.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> (perh. raglike) <hi rend="ital">substance that grows on the tree</hi> aegilops, <hi rend="ital">besides its acorns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 33</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33665.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an infant's swaddling-clothes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panni infantiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 38, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannuvellium: <entryFree id="n33666" type="gloss" key="pannu^velli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannŭvellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wound-up yarn of the woof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bobbin of the shuttle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the yarn wound upon it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=114" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 114</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pannychismus: <entryFree id="n33667" type="greek" key="panny^chismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannychismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pannuxismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching all night long</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pannychius: <entryFree id="n33668" type="greek" key="panny^chi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pannychĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pannu/xios</foreign>, <sense id="n33668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that lasts all night</hi>: negotium, Marc. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 3, 5</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
panomphaeus: <entryFree id="n33669" type="greek" key="Pa^nomphaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănomphaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*panomfai=os</foreign> (the author of all oracles), <sense id="n33669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panope: <entryFree id="n33670" type="main" key="Pa^no^pe_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănŏpēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pano/ph</foreign>, <sense id="n33670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panopea virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 240</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 825</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panope matertera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:435" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 435</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33671" type="main" key="Pa^no^pe_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the south of Phocis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panopes arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:344" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 344</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panopion: <entryFree id="n33672" type="main" key="Pa^no_pi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănōpĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">panwpi/wn</foreign>, all eye</etym>, <sense id="n33672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panormitanus: <entryFree id="n33673" type="main" key="Pa^normi^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănormĭtānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Panh-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Panormus, I. B.</entryFree>
panormus: <entryFree id="n33674" type="main" key="Pa^normus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănormus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Panh-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păn-ormum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Panh-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/normos</foreign>, <sense id="n33674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33674.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Sicily</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Palermo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida Panormum, Solus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergemino venit numero fecundo Panormus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:262" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia Panhormi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 63</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n33674.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănormĭtānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Panh-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Panormitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati Panhormitani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>, § 13.—</sense><sense id="n33674.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Samos</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Port Viskaraho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10</bibl> and 11.—</sense><sense id="n33674.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panosus: <entryFree id="n33675" type="main" key="pa_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>panis</etym>, <sense id="n33675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like bread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus panosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:91" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:14:203" default="NO">2, 14, 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pansa: <entryFree id="n33676" type="main" key="pansa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pansa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pando</etym>, <sense id="n33676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broad-footed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splay-foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33677" type="main" key="Pansa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pansa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. C. Vibius Pansa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 9, 22</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 96</bibl>.
(† <orth extent="full" lang="la">pansĕbastus</orth>, a false read. for panerastus; <cit><quote lang="la">v. paneros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl></cit>.)</sense></entryFree>
pansus: <entryFree id="n33678" type="main" key="pansus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pansus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. pando.</entryFree>
pantagathus: <entryFree id="n33679" type="greek" key="panta^ga^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pantăgăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pantagaqo/s</foreign> (all good). <sense id="n33679.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bird of good omen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Anton. Diadum. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33679.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> pulegium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pantagias: <entryFree id="n33680" type="main" key="Panta^gi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pantăgĭas</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pantăgĭes</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pan-tăgia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pantagi/hs, *pantagi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n33680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in the eastern part of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Megaris and Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fiume di Porcari</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia Pantagiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 689</bibl></cit> Serv.; (<case>acc.</case> -ien) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:471" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 471</bibl>; (<case>acc.</case> -iam) <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pantaleon: <entryFree id="n33681" type="main" key="Panta^le^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pantălĕon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pantale/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n33681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pantarces:
<entryFree id="n33682" type="main" key="Pantarces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pantarces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pantarkh/s</foreign>, all-helping</etym>, <sense id="n33682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Jupiter;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 199</bibl>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">pantĕlīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pantelei=on</foreign> (allperfect), <hi rend="ital">a holocaust offered in the worship of Mithras</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 358.</sense></entryFree>
pantex: <entryFree id="n33683" type="main" key="pantex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pantex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, and usu. <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pantĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the paunch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bowels</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">venter, ilia): eo vos vostrosque pantices madefacitis, quom ego sim hic siccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: et aestuantes docte solvis pantices,<cb n="PANY" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">sausages</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 28</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 83, 19</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
pantheon: <entryFree id="n33684" type="main" key="Panthe_^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panthē^on</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/nqeon, *pa/nqeion</foreign>, <sense id="n33684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the great temple of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Agrippa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and restored by Hadrian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">M. Aurelius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Septimius Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Caracalla</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Tempio di S. Maria Rotonda</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippae Pantheum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 38</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 102</bibl>, read tectum diribitori); 34, 3, 7, § 13; 9, 35, 58, § 121; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33684.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The statue of a god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned with the symbols of several other deities</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1, 3 sq.</bibl>; cf. Spon. Miscell. Antiq. p. 19.</sense></entryFree>
panther: <entryFree id="n33685" type="main" key="panther1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panther</orth>, <itype>eris</itype>, v. 1. panthera.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33686" type="greek" key="panther2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panther</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/nqhron</foreign>, <sense id="n33686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hunting-net</hi> for catching wild beasts: <cit><quote lang="la">rete quoddam panther,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 100</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
panthera: <entryFree id="n33687" type="greek" key="panthe_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panthēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/nqhr</foreign>, like statera for <foreign lang="greek">stath/r</foreign> (<sense id="n33687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pan-ther</orth>, Auct. Carm. Phil. 50), <hi rend="ital">a panther</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictarumque jacent fera corpora pantherarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 669</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panthera imprudens olim in foveam decidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—The Romans were fond of introducing it in their combats of wild beasts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33688" type="greek" key="panthe_ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panthēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">panqh/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n33688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entire capture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all that is caught at once</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emere pantheram ab aucupe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:11:section=18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 11, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pantherinus: <entryFree id="n33689" type="main" key="panthe_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panthērīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. panthera</etym>, <sense id="n33689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a panther</hi> or <hi rend="ital">panthers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33689.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33689.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spotted like a panther</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n33689.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantherinum genus (hominum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pantheum: <entryFree id="n33690" type="main" key="Pantheum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pantheum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Pantheon.</entryFree>
panthius: <entryFree id="n33691" type="main" key="Panthi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panthĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the fifty sons of Ægyptus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panthous: <entryFree id="n33692" type="main" key="Pantho^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panthŏus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Panthūs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/nqoos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">-ons</foreign>), <sense id="n33692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nephew of Hecuba and father of Euphorbus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panthus Othryades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panthous,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 115" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 115</bibl></cit>. —In <case>voc.</case> Panthu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 322</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33692.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Panthŏĭdĕs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Panthous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Euphorbus.</hi> Pythagoras maintained that his soul animated the body of Euphorbus at the time of the Trojan war, and for this reason he was called Panthoi des: <cit><quote lang="la">Panthoides Euphorbus eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habentque Tartara Panthoiden iterum Orco Demissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pantica: <entryFree id="n33693" type="main" key="Panti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pantĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Panda.</entryFree>
panticapeum: <entryFree id="n33694" type="main" key="Panticape_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panticapēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the Cimmerian Bosporus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Kertch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pantices: <entryFree id="n33695" type="main" key="panti^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pantĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. pantex.</entryFree>
pantolabus: <entryFree id="n33696" type="main" key="Panto^la^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pantŏlăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pantola/bos</foreign>, that takes all</etym>, <sense id="n33696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a parasite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pantomima: <entryFree id="n33697" type="main" key="panto^mi_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pantŏmīma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pantomimus</etym>, <sense id="n33697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female ballet-dancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons ad Helv. 12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons ad Helv. 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pantomimicus: <entryFree id="n33698" type="main" key="panto^mi_mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pantŏmīmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pantomimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantomimic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pantomimus: <entryFree id="n33699" type="greek" key="panto^mi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pantŏmīmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">panto/mimos</foreign>, <sense id="n33699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ballet-dancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantomime</hi> (cf.: ludius, mimus). <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:56" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:32:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 32, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panucla: <entryFree id="n33700" type="gloss" key="pa_nu^cla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānŭcla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. panicula <sense id="n33700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
panuncula: <entryFree id="n33701" type="gloss" key="pa_nuncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panus</etym>, <sense id="n33701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thread wound upon the bobbin</hi> in a shuttle, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panus: <entryFree id="n33702" type="greek" key="pa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ph=nos</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">pa=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n33702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thread wound upon the bobbin</hi> in a shuttle. </sense><sense id="n33702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: intus modo stet rectus subteminis panus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 24</bibl>; cf.: panus tramae involucrum, quem diminutive panuclam vocamus, Non. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n33702.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33702.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumor quoque inguinum ex formae similitudine sic (sc. panus) vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 24</bibl></cit>; Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 25" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panos aperit sevum pecudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:97" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 58, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:195" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 17, 57, § 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscum panos mitigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33702.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An ear of millet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panyasis: <entryFree id="n33703" type="main" key="Panya^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panyăsis</orth>, <case>acc.</case> sin, = <foreign lang="greek">*panu/asis</foreign>, <sense id="n33703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a relative of Herodotus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 54</bibl>. <pb n="1299" /> <cb n="PAPI" /></sense></entryFree>
papa: <entryFree id="n33704" type="main" key="pa_pa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāpa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pappa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>onomatopoeia</etym>, <sense id="n33704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the word with which infants call for food</hi>: cum cibum ac potionem buas ac papas vocent, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33705" type="main" key="pa_pa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">papa;</hi> hence, in eccl. writers, <hi rend="ital">a bishop</hi>: optime papa, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 127; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33706" type="main" key="Papa3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Papa</orth>, <sense id="n33706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> Cl. 7</bibl>, n. 32.</sense></entryFree>
papae: <entryFree id="n33707" type="greek" key="pa^pae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpae</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">papai/</foreign>, <sense id="n33707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wonderful! how strange! indeed!</hi> papae! divitias tu quidem habuisti luculentas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">papae! jugularas hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paparium: <entryFree id="n33708" type="main" key="pa_pa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāpārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. papa</etym>, <sense id="n33708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papas: <entryFree id="n33709" type="greek" key="papas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">papas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pappas</orth>), <itype>ae and ătis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/ppas</foreign>, <sense id="n33709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a governor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidus praegustet pocula papas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:632" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 632</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1297, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papaver: <entryFree id="n33710" type="main" key="pa^pa_ver"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpāver</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (ante-class., <gen>m.</gen>) [etym. dub.; cf. root pa- of pasco, <foreign lang="greek">pe/pamai</foreign>], <sense id="n33710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the poppy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33710.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: papaver Gallicanus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 64</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sesamum papaveremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>;
