<xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, prov.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargens soporiferum papaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 486</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaeo perfusa papavera somno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 40, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:198" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 18, 76, § 198</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa papaverum capita,</quote> <trans><tr>the heads of the tallest poppies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Petr. poët. 132, 11.—Prov.: confit cito, Quam si formicis tu obicias papaverem, of any thing that quickly disappears,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33710.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kernel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaver fici,</quote> <trans><tr>fig-seed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33710.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta quasi papavere et sesamo sparsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
papaveratus: <entryFree id="n33711" type="main" key="pa^pa_ve^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpāvĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>papaver</etym>, <sense id="n33711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made shining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">white with poppies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 195</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 4, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papaverculum: <entryFree id="n33712" type="main" key="pa^pa_vercu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpāvercŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> leontopodion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papavereus: <entryFree id="n33713" type="main" key="pa^pa_ve^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpāvĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of poppies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <trans><tr>poppy-flowers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:438" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 438</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paphiacus: <entryFree id="n33714" type="main" key="Pa^phi^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Paphos.</entryFree>
paphlago: <entryFree id="n33715" type="main" key="Paphla^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paphlăgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paflagw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Paphlagonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paphlagonum sata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 969</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 72</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33715.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paphlă-gŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Paphlagonian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paphlăgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the province of Paphlagonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Bithynia and Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paphos: <entryFree id="n33716" type="main" key="Pa^phos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n33716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Pygmalion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the city of Paphos</hi> (v. 2. Paphos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 242" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 242</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33717" type="main" key="Pa^phos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n33717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the island of Cyprus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a celebrated temple of Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the modern Baffo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 96, 97, § 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est celsa mihi Paphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Paphon veterem linquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:61" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eum de Pharsalicā fugā Paphum persecuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33717.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphĭă-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Paphian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 227</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33717.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Paphian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive cupis Paphien,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:74:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 74, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33717.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of lettuce that grew on the island of Cyprus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:193" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 193</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33717.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Paphian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paphiae myrti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paphia Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampades,</quote> <trans><tr>the planet Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:4:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicocles,</quote> <trans><tr>of Paphos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 63, § 167</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păphii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Paphos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33717.5" n="2" level="3"> Paphii thyrsi, <hi rend="ital">the stalks of the Cyprian lettuce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:370" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 370</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papia: <entryFree id="n33718" type="main" key="Pa_pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāpĭa lex</orth>, v. Papius.</entryFree>
papilio: <entryFree id="n33719" type="main" key="pa_pi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāpĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">pa/llw</foreign>, brandish; palpitare, pila</etym>, <sense id="n33719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butterfly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33719.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferali mutant cum papilione figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 374</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 14, 47, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:162" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 10, 45, § 162</bibl>.—Also of other winged insects, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 32, 37, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33719.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a tent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pavilion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in expeditionibus apertis papilionibus prandit atque coenavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pescen. 11</bibl>; Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. <cb n="PAPU" /> 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 16, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 11, 11</bibl>. The Fratres Arvales also made use of such tents when making their offerings in the grove of Dia, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. n. 41.</sense></entryFree>
papiliunculus: <entryFree id="n33720" type="main" key="pa_pi^li^uncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāpĭlĭuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>papilio</etym>, <sense id="n33720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little butlerfly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papilla: <entryFree id="n33721" type="main" key="pa^pilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>papula</etym>, <sense id="n33721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nipple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teat</hi>, on the breast of human beings and of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">papillae capitula mammarum dictae, quod papularum sint similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33721.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33721.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the breast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudantes rejectā veste papillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta sub exsertam donec perlata papillam Haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc nuda papillis constitit auratis,</quote> <trans><tr>her breasts adorned with gold chains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 122</bibl></cit>.—Of the male breast: <cit><quote lang="la">infra laevam papillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33721.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pustule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimple</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 64, 1100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33721.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rose-bud</hi>, Auct. Pervig. Ven. 14; 21.</sense></entryFree>
papillatus: <entryFree id="n33722" type="main" key="pa^pilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>papilla, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n33722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaped like a bud</hi>: corymbus, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 1, p. 699 Burm.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66</bibl>, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
papilus: <entryFree id="n33723" type="main" key="Pa_pi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāpĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:48" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papinianus: <entryFree id="n33724" type="main" key="Pa_pi^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāpĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman jurist under Septimius Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beheaded at the command of Caracalla</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 21</bibl>; Caracall. 4; 8.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33724.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā-pĭnĭānista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a follower</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admirer of Papinian</hi>, Just. in Ep. praef. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papinus: <entryFree id="n33725" type="main" key="Papi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Papīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Cisalpine Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papirius: <entryFree id="n33726" type="main" key="Pa^pi_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păpīrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păpīsĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 2</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a patrician and plebeian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 2</bibl>.—Thus, </sense><sense id="n33726.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The dictator</hi>, L. Papirius Cursor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.—</sense><sense id="n33726.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Papirius Carbo, <hi rend="ital">the friend of Ti. Gracchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n33726.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păpīrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Papirius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Papirian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Papiria lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the rural tribes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=232" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 232</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 766, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n33726.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păpīrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Papirian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30</bibl>: jus civile Papirianum, <hi rend="ital">a juridical compilation of</hi> S. Papirius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papius: <entryFree id="n33727" type="main" key="Pa_pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāpĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens.—</sense><sense id="n33727.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Papius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the originator of the</hi> lex Papia de peregrinis exterminandis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33727.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Papius Mutilus, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with his colleague</hi>, Poppaeus, <hi rend="ital">passed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the reign of Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> lex Papia Poppaea, <hi rend="ital">for the promotion of marriages</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28</bibl>; suet. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33727.3" n="3" level="3"> Papia, <hi rend="ital">wife of Oppianicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāpĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">Papia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Papia tribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 307, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">879, 6</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
papo: <entryFree id="n33728" type="main" key="papo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">papo</orth>, v. pappo.</entryFree>
pappa: <entryFree id="n33729" type="main" key="pappa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pappa</orth>, v. papa.</entryFree>
pappas: <entryFree id="n33730" type="main" key="pappas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pappas</orth>, v. papas.</entryFree>
pappo: <entryFree id="n33731" type="main" key="pappo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pappo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">papo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n33731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat pap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberto opus est quod pappet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pappus: <entryFree id="n33732" type="greek" key="pappus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pappus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/ppos</foreign>. <sense id="n33732.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An old man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 30</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n33732.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A grandfather</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33732.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The woolly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairy seed of certain plants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 386</bibl> Lachm.; also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">semen ei lanuginis, quam pappon vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 57, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33732.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> erigeron: <cit><quote lang="la">quare eam Callimachus acanthida appellat, alii pappum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
papula: <entryFree id="n33733" type="main" key="pa^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>root pamp-, pap, to swell; in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pomfo/s</foreign>; cf. 2. populus</etym>, <sense id="n33733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pustule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruptiones papularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubentes papulas sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 14, 56</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">papulas observatis alienas obsiti plurimis ulceribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you see the mote in your brother's eye</tr>, <tr>but not the beam in your own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
papulo: <entryFree id="n33734" type="main" key="pa^pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>papula</etym>, <sense id="n33734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> <cb n="PAR" /> <hi rend="ital">pustules</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pimples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papyraceus: <entryFree id="n33735" type="main" key="pa^py_ra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳrācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>papyrus</etym>, <sense id="n33735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of papyrus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ellychnium papyraceum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
papyrifer: <entryFree id="n33736" type="main" key="pa^py_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>papyrusfero</etym>, <sense id="n33736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">papyrus-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that produces papyrus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">papyrifer Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
papyrinus: <entryFree id="n33737" type="main" key="pa^py_ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>papyrus</etym>, <sense id="n33737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the papyrus plant</hi>: stilus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papyrio: <entryFree id="n33738" type="main" key="pa^py_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where papyrus grows abundantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papyrius: <entryFree id="n33739" type="main" key="pa^py_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of papyrus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of paper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
papyrus: <entryFree id="n33740" type="greek" key="pa^py_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">păpȳ-rum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/puros</foreign>, <sense id="n33740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the paper-reed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">papyrus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33740.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">papyrum ergo nascitur in palustribus Aegypti, aut quiescentibus Nili aquis ... triangulis lateribus, decem non amplius cubitorum longitudine in gracilitatem fastigatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Euphrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 73</bibl></cit>. Ships were made of it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vasis papyri super aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and sails and cordage from its bark,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also shoes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. ad Sen. 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and wicks,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the roots were used instead of wood,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 72</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and likewise for funeral piles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:97:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 97, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33740.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33740.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A garment made from the bark of the papyrus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctus patriā papyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33740.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Paper</hi> made of papyrus-stalk (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liber, charta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
par: <entryFree id="n33741" type="main" key="pa_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pār</orth>, <itype>păris</itype> (collat. form of the <sense id="n33741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. fem.</hi> paris, Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 764</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> pari and pare, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 14</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 763</bibl> ib.; the latter<usg type="style">poet.</usg>—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> usu. parĭum; parum, acc. to Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 110</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. para, another, and prae</etym>, <hi rend="ital">equal</hi> (cf.: aequus, similis). </sense><sense id="n33741.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">par est, quod in omnes aequabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par et aequalis ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo et pari jure cum civibus vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita beata ... par et similis deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:61:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 61, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est finitimus oratori poëta ac paene par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari atque eādem in laude aliquem ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelleges de hoc judicium meum et horum par et unum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares in amore atque aequales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertate esse parem ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: verbum Latinum (voluptas) par Graeco (<foreign lang="greek">h(donh/</foreign>) et idem valens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares ejusdem generis munitiones,</quote> <trans><tr>of equal size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similia omnia magis visa hominibus, quam paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares similesque (affectus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in re pari valet, valeat in hac, quae par est ... valeat aequitas, quae paribus in causis paria jura desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ingenia omnia paria esse non possunt: jura certe paria debent esse eorum inter se, qui sunt cives in eādem re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est eam esse naturam, ut omnia omnibus paribus paria respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Ariovisti pari intervallo constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (equites), dum pari certamine res geri potuit, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>horsemen against horsemen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with a respective <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis mentisque pares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:370" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cantare pares et respondere parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33741.2" n="(b)" level="5"> The thing with which the comparison is made is most freq. added in the <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego parem summis Peripateticis judico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his omnibus par iis, quos antea commemoravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni illi et virtute et laude par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti par in belligerando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par anseribus,</quote> <trans><tr>as large as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigio par,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>extremely rare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 97</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVOIVS FORMA VIRTVTEI PARISVMA FVIT, Epit. of the Scipios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parissumi estis hibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—Adverb. (colloq. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">feceris par tuis ceteris factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (with this case par is treated as a substantive; rare but class.), <hi rend="ital">an equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterpart</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ei erat hospes, par illius, Siculus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>his counterpart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 49</bibl></cit>: cujus paucos pares <pb n="1300" /> <cb n="PAR" /> haec civitas tulit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem metuis par hujus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubique eum parem sui invenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Amic. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Amic. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scalas pares moenium altitudine, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. Arus. Mess. p. 253 Lindem.: in quā par facies nobilitate suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:804" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 804</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non praecipuam, sed parem cum ceteris fortunae condicionem subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut enim cetera paria Tuberoni cum Varo fuissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu parem cum liberis tuis regnique participem fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 9</bibl></cit> (cited ap. Arus. Mess. p. 253 Lindem.; but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 34</bibl>, read parem ceteris). —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt omnes pares inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>) (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum par habetur honos summis et infimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fuisse in Themistocle paria et Coriolano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi haudquaquam par gloria sequatur scriptorem et auctorem rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos postea in parem juris libertatisque condicionem atque ipsi erant, receperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parem sapientiam hic habet ac formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mihi par ratio cum Lucilio est ac tecum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo offensae minimum, gratia par, ac si prope adessemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) The object of comparison is sometimes not expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">cui repugno, quoad possum, sed adhuc pares non sumus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>not equal to the task</tr>, <tr>able</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari proelio,</quote> <trans><tr>indecisive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares validaeque miscentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paria esse coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si periculum par et ardor certaminis eos irritaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33741.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Equal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a match for</hi> any one in any respect: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ne di quidem immortales pares esse possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: qui pares esse nostro exercitu (<case>dat.</case>) non potuerint, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, quod neque se parem armis existimabat, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sumus pares,</quote> <trans><tr>not on an equality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exime hunc mihi scrupulum, cui par esse non possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebo, Q. Fabi, parem, quem das, Hannibalem,</quote> <trans><tr>an opponent</tr>, <tr>adversary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter pares aemulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ope Palladis Tydiden Superis parem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Equal</hi> in station or age, <hi rend="ital">of the same rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the same age</hi> (syn. aequalis): <cit><quote lang="la">ut coëat par Jungaturque pari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua voles apte nubere, nube pari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 25, 5</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">pares vetere proverbio cum paribus facillime congregantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>birds of a feather flock together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.8" n="3" level="3"> Par est, <hi rend="ital">it is fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33741.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: oportet, aequum, justum est): amorin me an rei opsequi potius par sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterius istaec te magis par agere'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canem esse hanc par fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par est primum ipsum esse virum bonum, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic par est agere cum civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitans, quid me facere par sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid erit, quod me scire par sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (ornamentis) fretum ad consulatūs petitionem aggredi par est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegi par est, eos qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33741.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Ut par est (erat, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): ita, ut constantibus hominibus par erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut par fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n33741.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non par videtur neque sit consentaneum ... ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.12" n="4" level="3"> Par pari respondere, or par pro pari referre, <hi rend="ital">to return like for like</hi>, of a'repartee: <cit><quote lang="la">par pari respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paria paribus respondimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sit unde par pari respondeatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par pro pari referto, quod eam mordeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit> Fleck., Umpfenb., cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl> (Bentl. ex conject. par, pari; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 281, ed. 5).—</sense><sense id="n33741.13" n="5" level="3"> Paria facere, <hi rend="ital">to equalize</hi> or <hi rend="ital">balance</hi> a thing with any thing, <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum rationibus domini paria facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:24" default="NO">11, 1, 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33741.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliter beneficium detur, aliter reddatur, paria facere difficile est,</quote> <trans><tr>to return like for like</tr>, <tr>to repay with the same coin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: denique debet poenas:<cb n="PAR" />  non est quod cum illo paria faciamus, <hi rend="ital">repay him</hi>, id. Ira, 3, 25, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil differamus, cotidie cum vitā paria faciamus,</quote> <trans><tr>settle our accounts with life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 101, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 86, 88, § 202</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">parem rationem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.15" n="6" level="3"> Ludere par impar, <hi rend="ital">to play at even and odd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 248</bibl>: August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33741.16" n="7" level="3"> Ex pari, adverb., <hi rend="ital">in an equal manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on an equal footing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens cum diis ex pari vivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n33741.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33741.18" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pār</orth>, <itype>păris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs venit, et adcumbit cum pare quisque suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:526" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungi cum pare suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicere est ausus cum illo suo pari, quem omnibus vitiis superare cupiebat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a table companion</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">o/mo/klinos</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ibi opulentus tibi par forte obvenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 68</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo parem quem pepigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit> (v. also I. A. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>. supra).—</sense><sense id="n33741.19" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pār</orth>, <itype>păris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum par nobilissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce tibi geminum in scelere par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par nobile fratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par columbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par mularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:212" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria aut quatuor paria amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scyphorum paria complura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paria (gladiatorum) ordinaria et postulaticia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: pocula oleaginea paria duo, Lab. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:30.Hence" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 30.Hence</bibl>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">equally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in an equal degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33741.20" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: dispartiantur patris bona pariter, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 375, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nostra in amicos benevolentia illorum erga nos benevolentiae pariter aequaliterque respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetamur amicorum laetitiā aeque atque nostrā, et pariter dolemus angoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritate non pariter omnes egemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pariter extrema terminentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gustandi et pariter tangendi magna judicia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla pro sociā obtinet, pariter omnes viles sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta pariter Romanis adversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: tantumdem est; <cit><quote lang="la">feriunt pariter,</quote> <trans><tr>all the same</tr>, <tr>nevertheless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:298" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 298</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.21" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculi mecum pariter moleste ferent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter nobiscum progredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 572</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.22" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">is ex se hunc reliquit filium pariter moratum, ut pater avusque hujus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter hoc fit, atque ut alia facta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu pariter atque animo varius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter ac si hostis adesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.23" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">et</hi> ... <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariterque et ad se tuendum et ad hostem petendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter et habitus et nomina edocebuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 556</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (in late poets, and once in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">pariter ultimae (gentes) propinquis, imperio parerent,</quote> <trans><tr>the remotest as well as the nearest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 166</bibl>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">qualis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter suades, qualis es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 37</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33741.24" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33741.25" n="1" level="3"> Like simul, of equality in time or in association, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam plura castella Pompeius pariter, distinendae manūs causā, tentaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>at the same time</tr>, <tr>together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter decurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pariter et socii rem inciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 48</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plura simul invadimus, si aut tam infirma sunt, ut pariter impelli possint, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pariter multos invadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO">1, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4</bibl>. 56; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 40, § 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.26" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (so commonly in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">conchyliis omnibus contingere, ut cum lunā pariter crescant pariterque decrescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia doctrinae pariter cum aetate crescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum vitā sensus amittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites pariter cum occasu solis expeditos educit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes">77, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:106:5" default="NO" valid="yes">106, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum collegā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 17, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.27" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">que</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventionem et dispositionem pariter exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:25" default="NO">1, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus mens pariter atque oratio insurgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seriis jocisque pariter accommodato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.28" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:122" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariterque favillis Durescit glacies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33741.29" n="2" level="3"> In order to give greater vivacity <cb n="PARA" /> to the expression, reduplicated: pariter ... pariter, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc pariter vidit, pariter Calydo nius heros Optavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 324</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33741.30" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariterque oppidani agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam pariter nymphas incedere vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 445</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parabilis: <entryFree id="n33742" type="main" key="pa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paro</etym>, <sense id="n33742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily procured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy to be had</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of easy attainment</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque parabilem amo venerem facilemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus (corporis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:14" default="NO">8, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parabola: <entryFree id="n33743" type="greek" key="pa^ra^bo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăbŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">părăbŏlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parabolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comparison.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33743.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: in omni parabole aut praecedit similitudo, res sequitur; <cit><quote lang="la">aut praecedit res, similitude sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:59" default="NO">6, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui simpliciter et demonstrandae rei causā eloquebantur, parabolis referti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33743.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an allegorical relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 5</bibl>; Aug. quaest. Evang. 2, 45; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n33743.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A proverb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 4, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33743.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A taunting speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,043:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Hab. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33743.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any speech</hi>, esp. in phrase: <cit><quote lang="la">assumptā parabolā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 23, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parabolanus: <entryFree id="n33744" type="main" key="pa^ra^bo^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăbŏlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>parabolus, lit., a reckless person</etym>, <sense id="n33744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sick-nurse</hi>, esp. in infectious diseases, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 18</bibl>; cf. Cod. Th. 16, 2, 42 and 43.</sense></entryFree>
parabolice: <entryFree id="n33745" type="main" key="pa^ra^bo^li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăbŏlĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>parabole</etym>, <sense id="n33745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">metaphorically</hi> dictare aliquid, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 15, 15 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
parabolus: <entryFree id="n33746" type="greek" key="pa^ra^bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/bolos</foreign>, <sense id="n33746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckless fellow</hi>, who risks his life on any thing, Cass. Hist. Trip. 11, 17.</sense></entryFree>
paracenterium: <entryFree id="n33747" type="greek" key="pa^ra^cente_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăcentērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parakenth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n33747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surgical instrument for making a perforation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a couching-needle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paracentesis: <entryFree id="n33748" type="greek" key="pa^ra^cente_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăcentēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parake/nthsis</foreign>, a surgical t. t., <sense id="n33748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perforation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a couching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tapping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 92, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paracharactes: <entryFree id="n33749" type="greek" key="pa^ra^cha^ractes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăchăractes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paraxara/kths</foreign>, <sense id="n33749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counterfeiter of coin</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 21, 9.</sense></entryFree>
paracharaximus: <entryFree id="n33750" type="main" key="pa^ra^cha^raxi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăchăraxĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">paraxara/kths</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n33750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>: adulterinus: adulterina nomismata et paracharaxima, Cassian. Colat. 1, 20.</sense></entryFree>
parachelois: <entryFree id="n33751" type="main" key="Pa^ra^che^lo_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părăchĕlōis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paraxelwis</foreign>, <sense id="n33751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Achelōus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paracletus: <entryFree id="n33752" type="greek" key="pa^ra_^cle_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părā^clētus</orth> (ĕ scanned short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 160</bibl>; id. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 430) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">părā^clī-tus</orth> (ĭ scanned short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Perieg. 2622</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/klhtos</foreign>. <sense id="n33752.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An advocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comforter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 55</bibl>; Res. Carn. f.: <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 14, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33752.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the œons of Valentinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paracynanche: <entryFree id="n33753" type="greek" key="pa^ra^cy^nanche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăcynanchē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parakuna/gxh</foreign>, <sense id="n33753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inflammation of one side of the throat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 1, 3</bibl> (al. parasynanche).</sense></entryFree>
parada: <entryFree id="n33754" type="foreign" key="pa^ra^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n33754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an awning</hi> of a boat: <cit><quote lang="la">subter paradas jacens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paradiastole: <entryFree id="n33755" type="greek" key="pa^ra^di^asto^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părădĭastŏlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paradiastolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which two different but similar things are put together and distinguished</hi> (pure Lat. distinctio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:Fig. Sent. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> Fig. Sent. 1, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Rufin. § 20 (written as Greek,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 65</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
paradigma: <entryFree id="n33756" type="greek" key="pa^ra^digma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părădigma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/deigma</foreign>, in gram. and rhet. lang., <sense id="n33756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paradigm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 248</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 460</bibl> ib.; Don. <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> p. 1779 ib. et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">paradigmate Platonico plenius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paradisiacus: <entryFree id="n33757" type="main" key="pa^ra^di_si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părădīsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paradisus</etym>, <sense id="n33757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Paradise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Paradisiacal</hi>: rosae, Ven. Fort. Carm. 6, 8, 1: Paradisiaca sedes, <hi rend="ital">Paradise</hi>, Alc. 1, 298.</sense></entryFree>
paradisicola: <entryFree id="n33758" type="main" key="pa^ra^di_si^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părădīsĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>paradisuscolo</etym>, <sense id="n33758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller in Paradise</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">in heaven</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 936</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paradisus: <entryFree id="n33759" type="greek" key="pa^ra^di_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părădīsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/deisos</foreign>, <sense id="n33759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a park.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33759.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vivaria quae nunc vulgus, quos <foreign lang="greek">paradei/sous</foreign> Graeci appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in paradiso, hoc est in viridario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 343" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 343</bibl></cit>, n. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 8</bibl>: malorum. <hi rend="ital">an orchard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cant. 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33759.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> <pb n="1301" /> <cb n="PARA" /> </sense><sense id="n33759.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Paradise</hi>, the dwelling-place of the first human beings, <hi rend="ital">the Garden of Eden</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52</bibl>, n. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">plantatus paradisus in Eden,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69</bibl></cit>, n. 6.—</sense><sense id="n33759.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Paradise</hi>, the abode of the blessed, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Judic. Dom. 195</bibl>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 44, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 23, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33759.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Cœlesyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33759.6" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in</hi> Cilicia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paradoxus: <entryFree id="n33760" type="greek" key="pa^ra^doxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părădoxus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/docos</foreign>, <sense id="n33760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marvellous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to all expectation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paradoxical;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33760.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pără-doxus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to expectation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">has conquered both in the</hi> lucta <hi rend="ital">and in the</hi> pancratium <hi rend="ital">on the same day;</hi> in Gr. usu. called <foreign lang="greek">paradoconi/khs</foreign> (late Lat.), Aug. Princip. Rhet. n. 9. The <hi rend="ital">mimes</hi> were also called paradoxi, Vet. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:184" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33760.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">părădoxum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n33760.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A figure of speech</hi>: paradoxon, sive hypomone, sustentatio vel inopinatum. Hoc schema suspendit sensum: deinde subicit aliquid eo, contra exspectationem auditoris, sive magnum sive minus; et ideo sustentatio vel inopinatum dicitur, Rufin.
