Fig. Sentent. § 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33760.4" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pără-doxa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/doca</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the apparently contradictory doctrines of the Stoics</hi>: haec <foreign lang="greek">para/doca</foreign> illi. nos admirabilia dicamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 74</bibl>; cf.: (illa) mirabilia Stoicorum quae <foreign lang="greek">para/doca</foreign> nominantur, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 136</bibl>: quae quia sunt admirabilia contraque opinionem omnium, ab ipsis (Stoicis) etiam <foreign lang="greek">para/doca</foreign> appellantur, tentare volui, etc. id. Par. prooem. 4.</sense></entryFree>
paraenesis: <entryFree id="n33761" type="greek" key="pa^raene^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păraenĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parai/nesis</foreign>, <sense id="n33761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admonition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precept; gen. plur.</hi> paraeneseōn, Vulc. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paraetacene: <entryFree id="n33762" type="main" key="Pa^raeta^ce_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păraetăcēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paraitakhnh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Persia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra Paraetacenen et Persiden,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33762.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păraetăcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paraita/kai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Parœtacenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păraetăcēni</orth>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*paraitakhnoi/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 29, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paraetonium: <entryFree id="n33763" type="main" key="Pa^raeto^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păraetŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paraito/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n33763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town in Northern Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Egypt and the Syrtes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Marsa Labeit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 772</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33763.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păraetŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parœtonian</hi>: portus, Mela, 1, 8, 2.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">păraetŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a certain white and pure chalk found near Parœtonium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parœtonium-white</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 18, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 5, 27, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33763.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paraetonius Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alexandria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <trans><tr>Egyptian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <trans><tr>African</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:450" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 450</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paragauda: <entryFree id="n33764" type="foreign" key="pa^ra^gauda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăgauda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">părăgau-dis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a border</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lace</hi>, worked on a garment. </sense><sense id="n33764.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auratae paragaudae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 10, 21, 1.—</sense><sense id="n33764.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a laced garment</hi>: interulas paragaudas duas, Val. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 4</bibl>: paragaudem triuncem unam, id. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paragoge: <entryFree id="n33765" type="greek" key="pa^ra^go_ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăgōgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paragwgh/</foreign>, in gram., <sense id="n33765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lengthening of a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the addition of a letter or syllable to a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paragoge</hi> (e. g. facio, facesso), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 226</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 309</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
paragogia: <entryFree id="n33766" type="greek" key="pa^ra^go_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăgōgĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paragw/gia</foreign>, <sense id="n33766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aqueducts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 42, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paragramma: <entryFree id="n33767" type="greek" key="pa^ragramma^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păragrammă</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/gramma</foreign>, <sense id="n33767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an error in writing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 71</bibl>, n. 5.</sense></entryFree>
paralipomena: <entryFree id="n33768" type="greek" key="Pa^ra^li_po^me^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părălīpŏmĕna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ paraleipo/mena</foreign> (things omitted, not related), <sense id="n33768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the books of the Chronicles in the Bible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53</bibl>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
paralius: <entryFree id="n33769" type="greek" key="pa^ra^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părălĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n33769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that grows by the seaside</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 19, 78, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 41, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parallelogrammus: <entryFree id="n33770" type="greek" key="pa^ralle_logrammus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părallēlogrammus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">parallhlo/grammos</foreign>, <sense id="n33770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of parallel lines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 116" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 116</bibl></cit> and 130 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
parallelonius: <entryFree id="n33771" type="main" key="pa^ralle_lo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părallēlōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, i. q. parallelus, <sense id="n33771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parallel</hi>: terminus, Auct. Limit. p. 310 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
parallelus: <entryFree id="n33772" type="greek" key="pa^ralle_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părallēlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">părallēlos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/llhlos</foreign>, <sense id="n33772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">paraliel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parallelos linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: circuli paralleli; or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> paralleli, concentric circles on the celestial globe, <hi rend="ital">parallels of latitude</hi>: nostri<cb n="PARA" />  circulos appellavere, Graeci parallelos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 33, 39, § 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 817</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paralus: <entryFree id="n33773" type="main" key="Pa^ra^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ralos</foreign> (of or belonging to the sea), <sense id="n33773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian hero whose portrait was painted by Protogenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 58, 58, § 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl> Zumpt.</sense></entryFree>
paralysis: <entryFree id="n33774" type="greek" key="pa^ra^ly^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părălysis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/lusis</foreign>, <sense id="n33774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">palsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paralysis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paralysi mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paralysi periclitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 15, 59, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens, paralysin cave,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paralyticus: <entryFree id="n33775" type="greek" key="pa^ra^ly^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părălytĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">paralutiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">struck with palsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paralytic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părălytĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a paralytic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a palsied person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graditur paralȳticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paralyticos restringere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to heal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paramese: <entryFree id="n33776" type="greek" key="pa^ra^me^se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părămĕsē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parame/sh</foreign>, <sense id="n33776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the string next to the middle;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the next to the middle note</hi>, B b <hi rend="ital">in the treble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33776.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the ring-finger;</hi> v. hypate.</sense></entryFree>
paranarrhinon: <entryFree id="n33777" type="main" key="pa^ra^narrhi_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părănarrhīnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, the same as antirrhinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 80, § 129</bibl>.</entryFree>
paranete: <entryFree id="n33778" type="greek" key="pa^ra^ne_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părănētē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paranh/th</foreign>, <sense id="n33778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the last string but one;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the note next to the highest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parangarius: <entryFree id="n33779" type="greek" key="pa^ranga^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părangărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/a)ggarei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is done besides the service to which one is bound</hi>: praestatio, Cod. Just, 1, 3, 2.—</sense><sense id="n33779.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părangărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a service over and above that which one is bound to render</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extra service</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12</bibl>, tit. 51; Cod. Th. 8, tit. 5.</sense></entryFree>
paranymphus: <entryFree id="n33780" type="greek" key="pa^ra^nymphus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părănymphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/numfos</foreign>, <sense id="n33780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bridesman</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 18; 6, 9; Ven. Fort. Carm. 8, 5, 305.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pără-nympha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a bridesmaid</hi>, = pronuba, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parapaestus: <entryFree id="n33781" type="greek" key="pa^ra^paestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăpaestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/paistos</foreign>, <sense id="n33781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot in poetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anapaestus, parapaestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parapamisus: <entryFree id="n33782" type="main" key="Pa^ra^pa^mi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părăpămīsus</orth>, v. Paropamisus.</entryFree>
parapegma: <entryFree id="n33783" type="greek" key="pa^ra^pegma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăpegma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/phgma</foreign> (something fixed on or hung up; hence), <sense id="n33783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a table of astronomical calculations</hi>, made of brass, and fixed or suspended to a pillar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parapetasius: <entryFree id="n33784" type="main" key="pa^ra^pe^ta^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăpĕtăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">parapeta/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n33784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that serves to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shelter;</hi> hence, aedificia parapetasia, <hi rend="ital">penthouses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheds</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 39.</sense></entryFree>
parapeteuma: <entryFree id="n33785" type="greek" key="pa^ra^pe^teuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăpĕteuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parape/teuma</foreign>, <sense id="n33785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ticket for which corn was received</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a corn-ticket</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 24, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parapherna: <entryFree id="n33786" type="greek" key="pa^ra^pherna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăpherna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/ferna</foreign>, <sense id="n33786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the separate possessions of a married woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her property besides her dower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 14, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paraphoros: <entryFree id="n33787" type="greek" key="pa^ra^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăphŏros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/foros</foreign>, <sense id="n33787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of an inferior sort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paraphoron alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paraphrasis: <entryFree id="n33788" type="greek" key="pa^ra^phra^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăphrăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/frasis</foreign>, <sense id="n33788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a paraphrase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paraphrasi vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:5" default="NO">10, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paraphrastes: <entryFree id="n33789" type="greek" key="pa^ra^phrastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăphrastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parafrasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that paraphrases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a paraphrast</hi>, Hier. praef. ad Libr. Reg. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parapienos: <entryFree id="n33790" type="greek" key="pa^ra^pi_e_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăpīēnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/-pih/eis</foreign>, <sense id="n33790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot in poetry</hi> (˘¯˘˘˘), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
parapotamia: <entryFree id="n33791" type="main" key="Pa^ra^po^ta^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părăpŏtămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district near the Tigris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 61, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parapsis: <entryFree id="n33792" type="main" key="pa^rapsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părapsis</orth>, v. paropsis.</entryFree>
pararius: <entryFree id="n33793" type="main" key="pa^ra_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>par</etym>, <sense id="n33793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pararium aes appellabatur id, quod equitibus duplex pro binis equis dabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33794" type="main" key="pa^ra_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paro</etym>, <sense id="n33794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 23, 2</bibl>; so of <hi rend="ital">the go-between</hi> in an intrigue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:15:2" default="NO">3, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parasanga: <entryFree id="n33795" type="greek" key="pa^ra^sanga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsanga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasa/gghs</foreign>, <sense id="n33795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian league</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parasang</hi>, containing 30 stadia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
parasceve: <entryFree id="n33796" type="greek" key="pa^ra^sce_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăscēvē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paraskeuh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the day of preparation</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the day before the Sabbath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Psych. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 23, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parasemum: <entryFree id="n33797" type="greek" key="pa^ra^se_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsēmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/shmon</foreign>, <sense id="n33797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ensign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flag of a ship</hi>, Vet. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 77</bibl></sense></entryFree>
parasiopesis: <entryFree id="n33798" type="greek" key="pa^ra^si^o_pe_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsĭōpēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasiw/phsis</foreign>,<cb n="PARA" />  <sense id="n33798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where one says he will not speak of such and such a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the very act of so doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggests it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasiopesis: hoc est, cum aliquid nos reticere dicimus et tamen tacitum intellegitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:Fig. Sent. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> Fig. Sent. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parasita: <entryFree id="n33799" type="main" key="pa^ra^si_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parasitus</etym>, <sense id="n33799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female parasite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciniflones, parasitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33799.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatrix avis ac parasita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parasitaster: <entryFree id="n33800" type="main" key="pa^ra^si_taster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsītaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorry parasite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitaster parvulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 610</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">618</bibl> and 628 P.</sense></entryFree>
parasitatio: <entryFree id="n33801" type="main" key="pa^ra^si_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playing the parasite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sponging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parasiticus: <entryFree id="n33802" type="main" key="pa^ra^si_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parasitic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuratiunculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: mensa, Aug. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor.</sense></entryFree>
parasitor: <entryFree id="n33803" type="main" key="pa^ra^si_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsītor</orth>. <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play the parasite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sponge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitando pascere ventres suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parasitus: <entryFree id="n33804" type="greek" key="pa^ra^si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/sitos</foreign>, lit. one who eats with another; hence, <sense id="n33804.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a guest</hi> (pure Lat. conviva): parasiti Jovis, <hi rend="ital">the gods</hi>, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 35</bibl>.—Hence, parasitus Phoebi, <hi rend="ital">a player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:29:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 29, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33804.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in a bad sense, one who, by flattery and buffoonery, manages to live at another's expense, <hi rend="ital">a sponger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toad-eater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parasite</hi> (syn. scurra): <cit><quote lang="la">nos parasiti planius ... Quasi mures semper edimus alienum cibum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitorum in comoediis assentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edaces parasiti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 139</bibl>. —Comically, of a whip: ne ulmos parasitos faciat, <hi rend="ital">that he will make his elm-twigs stick to me like parasites</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">give me a sound flogging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 5</bibl>.—The tutelar deity of parasites was Hercules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parastas: <entryFree id="n33805" type="greek" key="pa^rastas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părastas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasta/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a four-cornered pillar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pilaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl>; cf. parastata.</sense></entryFree>
parastata: <entryFree id="n33806" type="greek" key="pa^rasta^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părastăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasta/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n33806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square pillar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pilaster</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae habentes post se parastatas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit> (al. parastaticae).</sense></entryFree>
parastaticus: <entryFree id="n33807" type="greek" key="pa^rasta^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părastătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">parastatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pilasters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parastatic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 688</bibl>, n. 100.—</sense><sense id="n33807.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părastătĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parastatikh/</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n33807.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A square pillar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pilaster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae atque parastaticae (al. parastatae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>; cf. Inscr. Labus Epigrafe Lat. Scop. ap. Egitto, p. 7.—</sense><sense id="n33807.3" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părastătĭ-cae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">two bones in the knee of a horse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parastichis: <entryFree id="n33808" type="greek" key="pa^rasti^chis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părastĭchis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parastixi/s</foreign>, a word formed of the initial letters of verses, <sense id="n33808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an acrostic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 6</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 4</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
parasynanche: <entryFree id="n33809" type="main" key="pa^ra^sy^nanche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsynanchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasuna/gxh</foreign>, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; v. paracynanche.</entryFree>
parasynaxis: <entryFree id="n33810" type="greek" key="pa^ra^sy^naxis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăsynaxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasu/nacis</foreign>, <sense id="n33810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlawful assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasynaxes et conventicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 8, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paratarius: <entryFree id="n33811" type="main" key="pa^ra_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. paro</etym>, <sense id="n33811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily procured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
parate: <entryFree id="n33812" type="main" key="pa^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. paro, <sense id="n33812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paratio: <entryFree id="n33813" type="main" key="pa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. paro</etym>, <sense id="n33813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">getting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procuring</hi> (rare for comparatio; not in Cic.): nulla inest paratio, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <trans><tr>a striving after sovereignty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parator: <entryFree id="n33814" type="main" key="pa^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. c. Cresc. 1, 8.</sense></entryFree>
paratragoedo: <entryFree id="n33815" type="greek" key="pa^ratra^goedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păratrăgoedo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">paratragw|de/w</foreign>, <sense id="n33815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to express one's self in a tragic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompous manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut paratragoedat carnifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paratura: <entryFree id="n33816" type="main" key="pa^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. paro</etym>, <sense id="n33816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">materiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Virg. Vel. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paratus: <entryFree id="n33817" type="main" key="pa^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. paro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33818" type="main" key="pa^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. paro</etym>, <sense id="n33818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provision</hi>, = apparatus: nullum necessarium vitae cultum <pb n="1302" /> <cb n="PARC" /> aut paratum requirentis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 53</bibl>: paratu militum et armorum, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41, 3</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proviso ante funebri paratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natalem Vitellii diem celebravere ingenti paratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensaeque paratu Regifico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:652" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno cultu paratuque rerum et familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauto cenare paratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 13</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">largis paratibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 191</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrios induta paratus,</quote> <trans><tr>clothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris et ganeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paraveredus: <entryFree id="n33819" type="greek" key="pa^ra^ve^re_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părăvĕrēdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., from <foreign lang="greek">para/</foreign>-veredus</etym>, a horse for extraordinary occasions, <sense id="n33819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extra post-horse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 8, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parazonium: <entryFree id="n33820" type="greek" key="pa^razo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părazōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parazw/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n33820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dagger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parca: <entryFree id="n33821" type="main" key="Parca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">plek-</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ple/kw, plokh/</foreign>; Lat. plecto, plico</etym>, <sense id="n33821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the goddesses of Fate</hi>, whose Latin names are Nona, Decuma, and Morta, Caesell. Vindex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl> (their Greek names are Clotho, Lachesis, and Atropos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 171" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 171</bibl>).—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parca non mendax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenax veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:48" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 15, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Fates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcae, Hesperides, etc.: quos omnes Erebo et Nocte natos ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcae fatalia nentes Stamina non ulli dissoluenda deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veraces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic placitum Parcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 17, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parce: <entryFree id="n33822" type="main" key="parce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. parcus <sense id="n33822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
parciloquium: <entryFree id="n33823" type="main" key="parci^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>parce-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n33823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking sparingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve in conversation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parcimonia: <entryFree id="n33824" type="main" key="parci^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcĭmōnĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">parcĭmōnĭum</orth>, v. parsim-.</entryFree>
parcipromus: <entryFree id="n33825" type="main" key="parci_^pro_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcī^prōmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>parce-promo</etym>, <sense id="n33825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that gives sparingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a niggard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curmudgeon</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum geniis suis belligerant parcipromi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parcitas: <entryFree id="n33826" type="main" key="parci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parcus</etym>, <sense id="n33826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sparingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parsimony</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">animadversionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 7:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio, parcitas, sobrietas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:118" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 26, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33826.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mercy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā parcitate verberare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, Hist. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eccl.</author> 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parciter: <entryFree id="n33827" type="main" key="parci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. parcus <sense id="n33827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
parco: <entryFree id="n33828" type="main" key="parco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parco</orth>, <itype>pĕperci</itype>, less freq. parsi (the former constantly in Cic. and Cæs., the latter ante-class. and post-Aug.: parcui, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 21</bibl>, or Com. 69 Rib.; <sense id="n33828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> parsurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parciturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 14, 2</bibl></cit>), parsum, and less correctly <itype>parcĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [for sparco; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sparno/s</foreign>, rare; cf. Engl. spare; but v. also paucus, parvus], <hi rend="ital">to act sparingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sparing</hi> with respect to a thing, <hi rend="ital">to spare;</hi> constr. usually with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> ante-class. also with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n33828.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33828.2" n="A" level="2"> Of things (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n33828.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil pretio parsit, filio dum parceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te rogo sumptu ne parcas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non parcam operae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec impensae, nec labori, nec periculo parsurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit, ne cui rei parcat ad ea perficienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum se exigue dierum XXX. habere, sed paulo etiam longius tolerare posse parcendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcens = parcus: parcentes ego dexteras Odi (= parcius administrantes vinum, flores, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">oleas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti atque auri memoras quae multa talenta, Gnatis parce tuis,</quote> <trans><tr>spare</tr>, <tr>reserve for your children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 532</bibl></cit> Serv.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui parcit virgae odit filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 13, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.6" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to spare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have mercy upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbear to injure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">punish</hi> (eccl. and late Lat.), usually with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pepercisti filio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 22, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 2, 4 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n33828.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33828.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spare</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to preserve by sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to use carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to injure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33828.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi parce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia autem praecipit, parcere omnibus, consulere generi hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: aedificiis omnibus publicis<cb n="PARC" />  et privatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:54:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 54, § 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiis et dignitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aetate confectis, non mulieribus, non infantibus pepercerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjectis, sed debellare superbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 853</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne reliquis quidem nepotibus parsurus creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus auribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to refrain from speaking on disagreeable topics</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">auribus et consuetudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to turn away one's eyes from an unpleasant sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:9:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcit Cognatis maculis similis fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (ante-and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque parcit in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce in feminam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">thyrso parcente ferit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:572" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 572</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To abstain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refrain from</hi> doing a thing; <hi rend="ital">to forbear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi> (cf.: desino, mitto): meo labori non parsi, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neque parcetur labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilio,</quote> <trans><tr>to make no use of proffered assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <trans><tr>abstain from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernis parcebant flatibus Euri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce metu,</quote> <trans><tr>cease from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33828.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbear</hi> (not in class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">visere opera tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hancine ego vitam parsi perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde parce, sis, fidem ac jura societatis jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcite, oves, nimium procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pias scelerare manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defundere vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne parce dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce postea paupertatem cuiquam objectare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 23, p. 289, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 43:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 43, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ori,</quote> <trans><tr>to refrain from speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n33828.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcito linguam in sacrificiis dicebatur, i. e. coërceto, contineto, taceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl></cit> Müll.—*</sense><sense id="n33828.15" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desist from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">precantes, ut a caedibus et ab incendiis parceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; so with <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">caede,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 130, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parcus: <entryFree id="n33829" type="main" key="parcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign> [v. parco], <sense id="n33829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sparing</hi> in any thing, esp. in expenditure; in a good and bad sense, <hi rend="ital">frugal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrifty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">economical; niggardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parsimonious</hi> (syn.: tenax, restrictus). </sense><sense id="n33829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33829.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrusisti me ad senem parcissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre parco ac tenaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus colonus, parcissimus, modestissimus, frugalissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcumque genus patiensque laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcā manu offerre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33829.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris non parcus aceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donandi parca juventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae parcus ac tenax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33829.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">operā haud fui parcus meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium parcus in largiendā civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam vereor, ne me in laudibus suis parcum, quam ne nimium putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam modica cultu, quam parca comitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 83:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 83, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium sanguinis parcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcissimus somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcissimus vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies non parca fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:30" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiorum parcissimus aestimator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:21:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcus Deorum cultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libidinem projecti, in cibum parci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcusque lacessere Martem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:680" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud parci Martem coluisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:464" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 464</bibl></cit>.—In gen., <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, not rash nor self-indulgent: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus sanitatis in homine parco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 31, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcior somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcissimus somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 590</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33829.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">parco sale contingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 60: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:111" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merito parcior ira meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:98" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">questaque sum vento lintea parca dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima mors parca quae venit apta die,</quote> <trans><tr>after a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit> (Parcae quae venit acta die, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 18</bibl> Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">et brevis somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms, parce (class.) and parciter (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n33829.6" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">parcē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n33829.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sparingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thriftily; penuriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parsimoniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce parcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: vivere parce, continenter, severe, sobrie,<cb n="PARE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parce ac duriter se habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce et duriter vitam agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium parce facere sumptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum parce et paulatim metiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur id tam parce tamque restricte faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce seminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">implet manum parcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:546" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 546</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33829.8" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sparingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi de te parce et timide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce et molliter aliquem laedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:474" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 474</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:756" default="NO">15, 756</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius dicere de laude alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius ista viris tamen obicienda memento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius Andromachen vexavit Achaia victrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius quatiunt fenestras,</quote> <trans><tr>rarely</tr>, <tr>seldom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 69</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem Romanam parcissime dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut parcissime dicam, nemo historicorum commendavit magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33829.9" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">parcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sparingly</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 515, 6</bibl>: praelibare, Claud. Mam. praef.</sense></entryFree>
pardalianches: <entryFree id="n33830" type="greek" key="parda^li^anches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pardălĭanches</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pardaliagxe/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of a poisonous plant</hi> (aconitum) <hi rend="ital">which chokes panthers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 27, 41, § 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pardalios: <entryFree id="n33831" type="greek" key="parda^li_^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pardălī^os</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parda/leios</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">li/qos</foreign>), <sense id="n33831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone spotted like a panther</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pardalis: <entryFree id="n33832" type="greek" key="parda^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pardălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/rdalis</foreign>, <sense id="n33832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female panther</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pardalium: <entryFree id="n33833" type="main" key="parda^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pardălĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pardalis</etym>, <sense id="n33833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ointment that smells like a panther</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pardus: <entryFree id="n33834" type="greek" key="pardus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pardus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/rdos</foreign>, <sense id="n33834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male panther</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc varias (pantheras) et pardos, qui mares sunt, appellant in eo omni genere creberrimo in Africā Syriāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:202" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 73, 94, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 123</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">si mutare potest Aethiops pellem suam, aut pardus varietates suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 13, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pareas: <entryFree id="n33835" type="greek" key="pa^re_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părēas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">părīas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parei/as</foreign>, <sense id="n33835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of snake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 721</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pareas serpens, qui semper in caudā ambulat et sulcum facere videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parectatus: <entryFree id="n33836" type="greek" key="pa^recta^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părectătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pare/ktatos</foreign>, <sense id="n33836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marriageable</hi> (ante-class.), Lucil. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 67, 11 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
paredros: <entryFree id="n33837" type="greek" key="pa^re_^dros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părē^dros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/redros</foreign>, <sense id="n33837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that sits by one's side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remains with one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paredri spiritus,</quote> <trans><tr>familiar spirits</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paregoria: <entryFree id="n33838" type="greek" key="pa^re_go^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părēgŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parhgori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alleviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paregoriam praestare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paregoricus: <entryFree id="n33839" type="main" key="pa^re_go^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părēgŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paregoria</etym>, <sense id="n33839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alleviating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuaging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paregorizo: <entryFree id="n33840" type="main" key="pa^re_go^rizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părēgŏrizo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 122:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 122, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parelion: <entryFree id="n33841" type="greek" key="pa^re_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părēlĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parh/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n33841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mock sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parhelion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parelia sunt imagines solis in nube spissā et vicinā in modum speculi. Quidam parelion ita definiunt: nubes rotunda et splendida, similisque soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solent et bina fieri parelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parens: <entryFree id="n33842" type="main" key="pa_rens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pareo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33843" type="main" key="pa^rens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n33843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> parentum and parentium, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 66</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 111</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 282</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">masculino genere parentem appellabant antiqui etiam matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=151" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 151</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 79</bibl></cit> P.) [pario], <hi rend="ital">a procreator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a father</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parent;</hi> most freq. in the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">parents.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33843.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: SI PARENTEM PVER VERBERIT ... DIVIS PARENTVM SACER ESTO, Lex regia: qui parentem aut hospitem Necasset, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 239 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">parens tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 29, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 313</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum et parentis crediderim sui Fregisse cervicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alma parens Idaea deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tu reris eum (Orestem) occisā insanuisse parente? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator, qui sibi parentis loco esset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>entitled to the reverence due a father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lolliam) privignis parentis loco futuram,</quote> <trans><tr>be a mother to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12</bibl></cit>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis eam (Darii matrem) loco diligi colique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per speciem honorandae parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1303" /> <cb n="PARE" /> 22, 2; 26, 49, 13.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (caritas) est inter natos et parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes cum liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:42:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 42, § 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus a parentibus majoribusque meis relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parentum loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 28</bibl></cit>.— Of animals, <hi rend="ital">a sire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravida stans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:231" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 231</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33843.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33843.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Grandparents</hi>, and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">progenitors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestors</hi> (parentes, like patres, is used of the generations immediately preceding the present;
