all ancestors more remote than the grandparents are called majores, Seyffert ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:page=260" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. p. 260</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam tantum ac Sardiniam parentibus nostris ereptas nostrā virtute recuperaturi essemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatione parentis non tantum pater, sed etiam avus et proavus, et deinceps omnes superiores continentur: sed et mater et avia et proavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:51" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">619</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si patriam, parentes, antiqua mallent quam dominos et colonias novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33843.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Relations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kinsfolk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">solent rei capitis adhibere vobis parentes. Duos ego fratres nuper amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl>.—(Whether we are to take it in this sense in Liv 34, 32, 12, is doubtful.) —</sense><sense id="n33843.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">me quem nonnulli conservatorem istius urbis, quem parentem esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum parens effectorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates parens philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullius facundiae Latiarumque litterarum parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 117</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus primus doctrinarum et antiquitatis parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mercurius) curvae lyrae parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum (rerum) parens est educatrixque sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 24, 62</bibl></cit>.—As an honorary appellation: <cit><quote lang="la">quid prius dicam solitis Parentis Laudibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Domitian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:178" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 178</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parentalia: <entryFree id="n33844" type="main" key="pa^renta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părentālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum, v parentalis</itype>, II. B.</entryFree>
parentalis: <entryFree id="n33845" type="main" key="pa^renta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. parens</etym>, <sense id="n33845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to parents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parental</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>of my parents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:87" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33845.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the festival in honor of dead parents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relatives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the day of the festival in honor of the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:548" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the annually repeated combat of the birds which rose from Memnon's funeral pile</tr>, <tr>and which were therefore regarded as his children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 619</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 13, 4</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n33845.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părentālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n33845.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A festival in honor of dead relations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut parentalia cum supplicationibus miscerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3927</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4084</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PARENTALIORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3999</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33845.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a work by Ausonius.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parentatio: <entryFree id="n33846" type="main" key="pa^renta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parento</etym>, <sense id="n33846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">funeral obsequies for parents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near relatives</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parentela: <entryFree id="n33847" type="main" key="pa^rente_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părentēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. parens</etym>, <sense id="n33847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relationship</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parentia: <entryFree id="n33848" type="main" key="pa^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părentĭa</orth>, v. parientia.</entryFree>
parenticida: <entryFree id="n33849" type="gloss" key="pa^renti^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părentĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>parens-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n33849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parricide</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parento: <entryFree id="n33850" type="main" key="pa^rento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. parens</etym>, <sense id="n33850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to offer a solemn sacrifice in honor of deceased parents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relatives</hi> (cf.: lito, sacrifico). </sense><sense id="n33850.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus sepulcrum usquam exstet, ubi parentetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentemus Cethego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Februario mense mortuis parentari voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiā maximā parentare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>; Cenot. Pis. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 643</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuis certe interdiu parentatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sacrificamus, nec parentamus: sed neque de sacrificato et parentato edimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33850.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to revenge the death of a parent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near relative by that of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make therewith an offering to his manes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare omnes perferre acerbitates, quam non civibus Romanis, qui Genabi perfidiā Gallorum interissent, parentarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentandum regi sanguine conjuratorum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:1" default="NO">5, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti legionum sanguine fratri parentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 16</bibl></cit> (35), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus supplicio uxoris Manibus parentavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cb n="PARE" /> so, Manibus eorum vastatione Italiae, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:20" default="NO">3, 21, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnonis umbris sollenni caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum manibus sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33850.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">internecione hostium justae irae parentatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:20" default="NO">3, 21, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pareo: <entryFree id="n33851" type="main" key="pa_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">parrĕo</orth>), <itype>ŭi, pārĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">intr.</hi> form of paro, to make ready; părio, to bring forth; hence, to be ready, at hand</etym>, <sense id="n33851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show one's self; to be present</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at hand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33851.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): immolanti jocinera replicata paruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties paruit Hermogenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:29:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 29, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (fenestra) videt Inarimen, illi Prochyta aspera paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:76" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si parent simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli cui sidera parent,</quote> <trans><tr>are open</tr>, <tr>intelligible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 176</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>.—So freq. in eccl. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">parebit signum filii hominis in caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paret = videtur: si paret eum dare oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:91" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:4" default="NO">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:34 al" default="NO">34 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33851.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33851.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To appear</hi> (as a servant) at a person's commands, <hi rend="ital">to attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wait upon</hi> (very rare, for the usual apparere): <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus in provincias euntibus parere et praeministrare servorum vice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad memoriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pesc. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33851.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33851.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To obey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be obedient to; to submit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comply with</hi> (the class. signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: oboedio, obsequor, obtempero): parere, obedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll.: animadverte ac dicto pare, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 299 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic parebit et oboediet praecepto illi veteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oboedire et parere alicujus voluntati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut pareret et dicto audiens esset huic ordini, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(noster populus) in bello sic paret, ut regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo patiente atque parente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:331" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 331</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto paretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissius imperanti melius paretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arbitri sententiae pareatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paritum fuerit condicioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with respective <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adeo parebimus omnia matri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:660" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 660</bibl></cit>. —Of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">lucra petituras freta per parentia ventis Ducunt instabiles sidera certa rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 472</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33851.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To be subject to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dependent on; to be subservient to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla fuit civitas, quin Caesari pareret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum, quod regi paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se ei parere posse qui se feminam malit esse, quam virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae homines arant, navigant, aedificant, virtuti omnia parent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33851.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To submit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:60:202" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 60, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tempori et voluntati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori et iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo furori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:154" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 154</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33851.8" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To yield to</hi> one's promises or representations, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi> them; <hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:504" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: usuris, Cod. 4, 26, 8.— —</sense><sense id="n33851.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: paret, <hi rend="ital">it is clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid porro quaerendum est? factumne sit? at constat. A quo? at paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the formula si paret, <hi rend="ital">if it appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if it be proved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 2, 12, § 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si paret adversum edictum fecisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>, § 69; 2, 3, 22, § 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">paritum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137</bibl>; cf. II. 2. a. supra.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pārens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">obedient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentiores exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit> (al. paratiores).—</sense><sense id="n33851.10" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pārens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes abunde habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi quidem regere patriam aut parentes quamquam possis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex voluntate parentium occupare principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>; and so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl>, acc. to Bötticher (but parentes, in this passage, signifies <hi rend="ital">parents;</hi> cf. Kritz on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
pareoron: <entryFree id="n33852" type="greek" key="pa^re_o^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părēŏron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parh/oron</foreign>, <sense id="n33852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras heliotropion (vocat) pareoron,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parergon: <entryFree id="n33853" type="greek" key="pa^rergon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părergon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/rergon</foreign>, <sense id="n33853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extra ornament</hi>: adjecerit parvulas naves longas <cb n="PARI" /> in iis, quae pictores parerga appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77, 3 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părerga</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Attius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 61, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parhedrus: <entryFree id="n33854" type="main" key="Parhe^drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parhĕdrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/redros</foreign>, <sense id="n33854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 969, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parhippus: <entryFree id="n33855" type="greek" key="pa^rhippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părhippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/rippos</foreign>, <sense id="n33855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extra horse</hi> above the number allowed, demanded by a person who travels by the public post, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Just. 12, 51, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parhypate: <entryFree id="n33856" type="greek" key="pa^rhy^pa^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părhypătē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parupa/th</foreign>, <sense id="n33856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the string next to the uppermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the note next to the highest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pariambedes: <entryFree id="n33857" type="greek" key="pa^ri^ambe_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭambēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pariambw/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n33857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the metrical foot</hi>˘¯˘¯¯ <cit><quote lang="la">(e. g. pĕtītĭōnēs),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 479</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
pariambus: <entryFree id="n33858" type="greek" key="pa^ri^ambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pari/ambos</foreign>. <sense id="n33858.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A metrical foot consisting of a short and two long syllables</hi> (˘¯¯), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.— </sense><sense id="n33858.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A metrical foot consisting of a long and four short syllables</hi> (¯˘˘˘˘), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n33858.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A metrical foot consisting of two short syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonly called a</hi> pyrrhichius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 471</bibl> P.; cf. Mar. Vict. p. 2486 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parianus: <entryFree id="n33859" type="main" key="Pa^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Parium, II.</entryFree>
parias: <entryFree id="n33860" type="main" key="pa^ri_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părīas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pareas.</entryFree>
pariatio: <entryFree id="n33861" type="main" key="pa^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. pario</etym>, <sense id="n33861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balancing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settling</hi> of accounts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pariator: <entryFree id="n33862" type="main" key="pa^ri^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settler</hi> of an account, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:79" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pariatoria: <entryFree id="n33863" type="main" key="pa^ri^a_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balancing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settling</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 61" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parici: <entryFree id="n33864" type="gloss" key="pa_ri^ci_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārĭcī</orth>, v. parricidium.</entryFree>
paricida: <entryFree id="n33865" type="main" key="pa_ri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārĭcīda, -cīdālis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cīdĭum</orth>, v. parricida, etc.</entryFree>
pariens: <entryFree id="n33866" type="main" key="pa^ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. pario.</entryFree>
parientia: <entryFree id="n33867" type="main" key="pa_ri^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pareo</etym>, <sense id="n33867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obedience</hi> (post-class: and dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">others read patientia): parientiam accommodare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paries: <entryFree id="n33868" type="main" key="pa^ri^e_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭēs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 442</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 589</bibl>, pārietibus, quadrisyl.; see Carey's Lat. Prosody, § 47, p. 173) [kindr. with Sanscr. paryanta, from pari-iyanta, margo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/ras, pei=rar</foreign>], <sense id="n33868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wall</hi> (cf.: murus, maceria): aut permaceat paries percussus trifaci, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. trifax, p. 367 Müll. (Ann. v. 524 Vahl.): tosti alti stant parietes, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 116 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfodere parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perforator parietum,</quote> <trans><tr>a term of abuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi mus, in medio pariete vorsabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (domus nostra) non ea est, quam parietes nostri cingunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes disturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: itaque parietes modo urbis stant; <cit><quote lang="la">rem vero publicam penitus amisimus,</quote> <trans><tr>the walls</tr>, <tr>the houses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiores templi parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra parietes aluit eam gloriam, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes turris lateribus exstruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietibus textum caecis iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fissus tenui rimā paries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pro pariete subjectae et omni opere conjunctae,</quote> <trans><tr>like a wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non communione parietum sed propriis muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.—Of walls of wickerwork: <cit><quote lang="la">et paries lento vimine textus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:262" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">craticii parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 48, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 11, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">craticulam et parietes,</quote> <trans><tr>the top and sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 30, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tua res agitur, paries cum proximus ardet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrosque parietes linere,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry on both shoulders</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl></cit>: duos parietes de eādem fideliā dealbare, <hi rend="ital">to kill two birds with one stone</hi>, Cur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caducum parietem inclinare,</quote> <trans><tr>to lean on a broken reed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33868.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve inter vos significetis ego ero paries,</quote> <trans><tr>partition-wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>rampart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parietalis: <entryFree id="n33869" type="main" key="pa^ri^e^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭĕtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paries</etym>, <sense id="n33869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to walls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietalis herba,</quote> <trans><tr>the herb pellitory</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 13</bibl></cit>; cf. parietarius, II.</sense></entryFree>
parietarius: <entryFree id="n33870" type="main" key="pa^ri^e^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭĕtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to walls</hi>: structor, Firm. Math. 8, 24; Inscr. Rein. cl. 11, n. 112: pictor, Edict. Diocl. p. 19.—</sense><sense id="n33870.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭĕ-tārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the herb pellitory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parietary</hi>:<pb n="1304" /> <cb n="PARI" />  herbam perdicalem Latini muralem et parietariam, alii vitriariam appellant, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 81</bibl>.—Acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41</bibl>, Constantine the Great bestowed on the emperor Trajan, on account of the numerous inscriptions which he had caused to be placed on buildings, the sobriquet of herba parietaria (<bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 3, 7</bibl>, has instead, herba parietina).</sense></entryFree>
parietinus: <entryFree id="n33871" type="main" key="pa^ri^e^ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭĕtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paries</etym>, <sense id="n33871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to walls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietina forma,</quote> <trans><tr>the shape of a wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 20</bibl></cit>: herba, v. parietarius, II.—</sense><sense id="n33871.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭĕtĭnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">old fallen-down walls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruins</hi> (class.): villarum, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aizoum minus in muris parietinisque nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:183" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 119, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 36, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantis tenebris et quasi parietinis rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parilia: <entryFree id="n33872" type="main" key="Pa^ri_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Palilia, under Palilis.</entryFree>
parilicium: <entryFree id="n33873" type="main" key="pa^ri_li^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părīlĭcĭum</orth>, v. palilicium.</entryFree>
parilis: <entryFree id="n33874" type="main" key="pa^ri^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>par</etym>, <sense id="n33874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi> (anteclass. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">et noctes pariles agitare diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1067" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1067</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4, 5</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 29</bibl> Müll., paria is the better reading; v. Müll. ad loc.).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">equally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 191</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
parilitas: <entryFree id="n33875" type="main" key="pa^ri^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parilis</etym>, <sense id="n33875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equality</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 14</bibl>; Auct. Itin. Alex. 3 and 8 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
pariliter: <entryFree id="n33876" type="main" key="pa^ri^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. parilis <sense id="n33876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parilitius: <entryFree id="n33877" type="main" key="Pa^ri_li^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părīlĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um, Palilicius</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
pario: <entryFree id="n33878" type="main" key="pa^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>par</etym>. <sense id="n33878.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33878.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make equal;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with force of mid., <hi rend="ital">to be equal</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pariari deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33878.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay in full</hi> a debt: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: QVISQVIS MENSIB. CONTINENTER NON PARIAVERIT, <hi rend="ital">has not paid his share</hi>, Inscr. Lanuv. (a. p. Chr. 136) in Momms. Collegg. et Sodalicc. Romann.— In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> mid.: PARIATVS, <hi rend="ital">that has paid his share</hi>, Inscr. Lanuv. in Momms. Collegg. et Sodalicc. Romann.—</sense><sense id="n33878.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be equal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33879" type="main" key="pa^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭo</orth>, <itype>pĕpĕri, părĭtum, and partum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n33879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part.</hi> parturam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 86</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> paribis for paries, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parire, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 59</bibl> Müll., and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P.; Plaut. Fragm. ap. Philarg. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 63</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">por-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">e)/poron</foreign>, gave, <foreign lang="greek">pe/prwtai</foreign>, is fated; Lat. portio, partus, puerpera, perh. parare</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear;</hi> of animals, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spawn</hi>, etc. (syn. gigno). </sense><sense id="n33879.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quintum pareret mater ejus, asinum fuisse pariturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl></cit>: ut ea liberos ex sese pareret, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinas teneras, quae primum parient, concludat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 89</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quae gallina id ovum peperisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ova parire solet, etc., Enn. l. l. (Ann. v. 10 Vahl.): nam audivi feminam ego leonem semel parire, Plaut. l. l.—Of plants,</quote> <trans><tr>to flower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33879.2" n="B" level="2"> Transf </sense><sense id="n33879.3" n="1" level="3"> Of males, <hi rend="ital">to beget</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">apud tragicos: et jam leo pariet, at pater est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 34</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 464, 22</bibl> (in a corrupt passage).—</sense><sense id="n33879.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna putrefacta per imbres Vermiculos pariunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 899</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sarmentum in pariendis colibus vires habeat majores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:41:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges et reliqua, quae terra pariat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:112" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 10, 46, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 26, 18</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33879.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">genero, creo, gigno): ars dicendi habet hanc vim, non ut aliquid pariat et procreet, verum ut educet atque confirmet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 356</bibl></cit>: qui famam multo peperere labore, Enn. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 188</bibl> (Ann. v. 427 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem, voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinosiora multa pepererunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 114</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quibus etiam verba parienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc fabulae Scyllam et Charybdim peperere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quicquam nobis pariant ex se incommodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui aegritudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 22</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">alicni curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PARM" /> 23: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium amicos, veritas odium parit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi maximam laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meis laboribus dignitas salusque pariatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedā improbe partā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honeste partis bonis privare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante partam rei militaris gloriam amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam ingentem apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi decus et victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos officio et fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui somnum mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit> (6, 23): <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi letum Insontes peperere manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 434</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">partus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that has borne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parta nutrici consociata, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the ewe that has dropped the lamb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33879.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquired.</hi>— Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">parta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">acquisitions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod majus dedecus est parta amittere, quam omnino non paravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">d. H. 1, 41, 17 Dietsch: tantis parta malis curā majore metuque Servantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:303" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 303</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n33880" type="main" key="pa^ri^o3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, the ground form of aperio and operio.</entryFree>
parion: <entryFree id="n33881" type="main" key="Pa^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭon</orth>, v. Parium.</entryFree>
paris: <entryFree id="n33882" type="main" key="Pa^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ris</foreign>. <sense id="n33882.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Priam and Hecuba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Alexandros. <hi rend="ital">As soon as he was born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of an ominous dream of his mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he was exposed on Mount Ida to perish; he was there reared by the shepherds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and there he decided the dispute between Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Venus in favor of the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who promised him Helen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most beautiful of women</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a reward; by carrying her off to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he was the cause of the Trojan war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which he fell by the arrow of Philoctetes</hi>: quapropter Parim pastores nunc Alexandrum vocant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 82</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 74 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">culpatus Paris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium Paridis spretaeque injuria formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit> (3), 47.—</sense><sense id="n33882.1" n="B" level="2"> Cicero sarcastically applies the name of Paris to C. Memmius, on account of his relations with the wives of Lucullus and Pompey, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33882.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an actor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a freedman of Domitia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:87" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33882.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parisii: <entryFree id="n33883" type="main" key="Pa^ri_si^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părīsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Celtic Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering on the Senones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>. Their chief city, Lutetia Parisiorum (late Lat. also Parisii), stood on the isle of Paris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 5, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33883.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părīsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Parisians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parisian</hi>: arx, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:636" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 636</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">NAVTAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1066, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parison: <entryFree id="n33884" type="greek" key="pa^ri^son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭson</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/rison</foreign>, <sense id="n33884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an even balance in the members of a sentence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 531</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">written as Gr.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paritas: <entryFree id="n33885" type="main" key="pa^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>par</etym>, <sense id="n33885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parity</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in impari paritas contineri nequit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 78</bibl></cit>; Boëth. Arithm. 1, 5.</sense></entryFree>
pariter: <entryFree id="n33886" type="main" key="pa^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. par <sense id="n33886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parito: <entryFree id="n33887" type="main" key="pa^ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. paro</etym>, <sense id="n33887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be about</hi> to do a thing (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo nunc ire paritas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquas viginti minas Paritas ut a med auferas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paritor: <entryFree id="n33888" type="main" key="pa_ri^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pareo</etym>, <sense id="n33888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">body-guard</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
parium: <entryFree id="n33889" type="main" key="Pa^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭum</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n33889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Propontis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kamares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:61:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 61, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:622" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 622</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33889.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Parium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Parium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colias,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl></cit> (better read. Partianus).</sense></entryFree>
parius: <entryFree id="n33890" type="main" key="Pa^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Paros, II.</entryFree>
parma: <entryFree id="n33891" type="main" key="parma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parma</orth> (or in the collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pal-ma</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:82" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 82</bibl>; and so many MSS. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 19, 44</bibl> (3, 20, 8); 4 (5), 10, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 9</bibl>), ae (old <sense id="n33891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> parmaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 847</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/rmh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round shield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a target</hi>, carried by the light infantry and the cavalry. </sense><sense id="n33891.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: configunt parmam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 432 Vahl.); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 552, 30</bibl>: desiliunt ex equis, provolant <cb n="PARO" /> in primum agmen et pro antesignanis parmas obiciunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic miles (veles) tripedalem parmam habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 4</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 554, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picta fulgebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33891.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33891.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a shield</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Pallas) parmamque ferens hastamque trementem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 693</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:21:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 21, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33891.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gladiator armed with a</hi> parma, <hi rend="ital">a Threx</hi> (v. Threx) (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:69:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 69, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33891.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The valve in a pair of bellows</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 267</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33892" type="main" key="Parma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Parma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, <hi rend="ital">between Cremona and Placentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for its breed of sheep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velleribus primis Apulia, Parma secundis Nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:155:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 155, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:13:8" default="NO">5, 13, 8</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33892.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Par-mensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Parma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassī Parmensis opuscula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parmenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Parma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Parmans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 8</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13</bibl>, a.</sense></entryFree>
parmatus: <entryFree id="n33893" type="main" key="parma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. parma</etym>, <sense id="n33893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with the</hi> parma: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut parmatis, novae cohorti hostium, locus detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 39, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parmenides: <entryFree id="n33894" type="main" key="Parme^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parmĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parmeni/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n33894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Elea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with Zeno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was at the head of the Eleatic school</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parmenio: <entryFree id="n33895" type="main" key="Parme^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parmĕnĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parmeni/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n33895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">general and adviser of Philip of Macedon and of Alexander the Great.</hi>—Form Parmenio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl>.—Form Parmenion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4</bibl>, ext. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parmensis: <entryFree id="n33896" type="main" key="Parmensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parmensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 2. Parma, II.</entryFree>
parmessis: <entryFree id="n33897" type="main" key="Parmessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parmessis</orth>, v. Permessis.</entryFree>
parmula: <entryFree id="n33898" type="main" key="parmu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. parma</etym>, <sense id="n33898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round shield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small target.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33898.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictā non bene parmulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n33898.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parmulam ventilare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Or. Ep. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Or. Ep. 1</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
parmularius: <entryFree id="n33899" type="main" key="parmu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parmŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. parma, II. B.</etym>. <sense id="n33899.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An adherent of the party of the</hi> Threces, <hi rend="ital">who were armed with the</hi> parma, <hi rend="ital">a Parmularian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33899.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A servant of the</hi> pontifices <hi rend="ital">armed with the</hi> parma, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1087, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parnasus: <entryFree id="n33900" type="main" key="Parna_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parnāsus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parnas-sus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parnaso/s</foreign>, afterwards <foreign lang="greek">*parnasso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high mountain in Phocis with two peaks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Apollo and the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at whose foot was the city of Delphi and the Castalian spring</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">range of Liakhoura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons ibi verticibus petit arduus astra duobus, Nomine Parnasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 2" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:346" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnasi deserta per ardua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnasus gemino petit aethera colle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 72</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33900.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parnāsēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parnass-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parnassian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 619</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33900.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parnāsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parnass-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parnassian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauro Parnaside vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 165</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33900.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parnāsĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parnass-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parnassian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <trans><tr>of Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themis, so called because she possessed the Delphic oracle before Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:642" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>the Delphic oracle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:618" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 618</bibl></cit>: tu, precor, ignarum doceas, Parnasia, vatem, <hi rend="ital">O muse!</hi> Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 71.</sense></entryFree>
parnes: <entryFree id="n33901" type="main" key="Parnes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parnes</orth>, <itype>ēthis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/rnhs, -nhqos</foreign>, <sense id="n33901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain range in Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for its wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and abounding in game</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Noyia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnesque benignus vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:620" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 620</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paro: <entryFree id="n33902" type="main" key="pa^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. par, piparmi, to lead, to further; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">po/ros</foreign>; Lat. porta, peritus; also -per in pauper</etym>, <sense id="n33902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide; to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; syn.: apparo, comparo, acquiro); with personal, non-personal, and abstract objects; constr. usually with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33902.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33902.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n33902.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne paratum est, Ut jussisti ... prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres, falces, testudinesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1305" /> <cb n="PARO" /> 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ad integrum bellum cuncta parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 73, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod parato opus est, para,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam hic fugam aut furtum parat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; so with <case>acc.</case> of the act purposed: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to prepare one's self for flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 360</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <trans><tr>to introduce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba a vetustate repetita gratiam novitati similem parant,</quote> <trans><tr>furnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>.—More rarely with <hi rend="ital">reflex. pron.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">final clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or (mostly post-Aug.) with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce ego non paro me, ut rideant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin ita paret se, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad discendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad iter parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc te pares, haec cogites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterutri se fortunae parans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad similem casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
