G. 7, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24:48" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24, 48</bibl> (3, 19, 32): <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo, quam ad capiunda arma paraverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parantibus utrisque se ad proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad proelium vos parate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: foro se parant, Sen. Contr. praef. § 4.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita naturā paratum esset, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>so ordered</tr>, <tr>ordained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut simul in omnia paremur,</quote> <trans><tr>may habituate ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be on the point of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be about</hi> to do any thing: signa sonitum dare voce parabant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 46</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 447 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis deterrere (poëtam), ne scribat, parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones institutas parat perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni Numidiae imperare parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci parabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 46, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">in nemus ire parant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa parantem Dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 390</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aequom fuit deos paravisse, uno exemplo ne omnes vitam viverent,</quote> <trans><tr>have so ordered it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">age jam, uxorem ut arcessat, paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo virili praesentique ut sis, para,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom accepisti, haud multo post aliquid quod poscas paras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam unum dederis, centum quae poscat parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make preparations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare one's self</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">at Romani domi militiaeque intenti festinare, parare, alius alium hortari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra haec oppidani festinare, parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 76, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes">60, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussis (militibus) ad iter parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of fate, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destine</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): cui fata parent, quem poscat Apollo, <hi rend="ital">for whom the Fates prepare</hi> (death), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fata parent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 631</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:783" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 783</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus fata parabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quibus paratum est a Patre meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 20, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33902.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n33902.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego parabo Aliquam dolosam fidicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at dabit, parabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille bonus vir nobis psaltriam Paravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum mihi precatorem paro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera parare, quae parantur pecuniā ... amicos non parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum et sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin ei velut opes sint quaedam parandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lodice parandā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to procure with money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Piraeum ire volo, parare piscatum mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Tiberim hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi aere parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argento parata mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">părātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">prepared.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33902.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">ready</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex paratā re imparatam omnem facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; so (opp. imparata) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi erunt parata verba, huic homini verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos locos multā commentatione atque meditatione paratos atque expeditos habere debetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum ac paratum auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 6:22" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad bellum apta ac parata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvius et paratus umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: parata victoria, <hi rend="ital">an</hi> <cb n="PARO" /> <hi rend="ital">easy victory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod parati sunt facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratos esse et obsides dare et imperata facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia perpeti parati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se paratum esse decertare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33902.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">vel bello vel paci paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec praedae magis quam pugnae paratos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri acies ... parata neci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:117" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus sceleribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia peccantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athleta certamini paratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris ponendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus audendis paratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33902.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipped</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegit me ita paratum atque instructum ad judicium venire, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad permovendos animos instructi et parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis telisque parati ornatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo paratior ad usum forensem promptiorque esse possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratus ad navigandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnem eventum paratus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnīs causas paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mentiendum paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo simus ad dimicandum parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratiores ad omnia pericula subeunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: ab omni re sumus paratiores, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 6</bibl>: si paratior ab exercitu esses, Cael. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33902.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">well versed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Scaevola in jure paratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prompta et parata in agendo celeritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus maritimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.18" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te contra fortunam paratum armatumque cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.19" n="2" level="3"> Of mental preparation, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, in a good or bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad partes paratus veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam compositam Volsci belli, Hernicos ad partes paratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam (causarum operam) ego numquam, nisi paratus et meditatus accedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ad omne facinus paratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 15, § 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itane huc paratus advenis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi habent paratum quid de quāque re dicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 152</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">părātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n33902.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Preparedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with preparation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum parate venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratius atque accuratius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.21" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33902.22" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id parate curavi ut caverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33902.23" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promptly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratius venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratissime respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33903" type="main" key="pa^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>par</etym>, <sense id="n33903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem equal.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n33903.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem hercle vos pono et paro: parissumi estis iibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33903.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring to an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi> with any one: <cit><quote lang="la">se paraturum cum collegā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33904" type="main" key="pa^ro3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light ship</hi>, Cic. poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 20</bibl> (ed. Orell. IV. 2, p. 572); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parones navium genus, ad cujus similitudinem myoparo vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
parocha: <entryFree id="n33905" type="greek" key="pa^ro^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părŏcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paroxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supplying of necessaries</hi> to travelling public officers, <hi rend="ital">purveyance</hi> (cf. parochus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parochensis: <entryFree id="n33906" type="main" key="pa^ro^chensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părŏchensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>parochus</etym>, <sense id="n33906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parochial</hi> (eccl. Lat.): presbyteri, Montan. Ep. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
parochia: <entryFree id="n33907" type="main" key="pa^ro^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părŏchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. paroecia.</entryFree>
parochus: <entryFree id="n33908" type="greek" key="pa^ro^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/roxos</foreign>, <sense id="n33908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purveyor</hi>, a person who, for a certain sum, furnished travelling magistrates with necessaries, as beds, hay, straw, salt, etc. (pure Lat. copiarius). </sense><sense id="n33908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33908.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an entertainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">host</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parodia: <entryFree id="n33909" type="greek" key="pa^ro_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părōdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parw|di/a</foreign> (a counter-song), <sense id="n33909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reply retaining nearly the same words or the same turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parody</hi>, Ps.<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 1:10:29" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 1, 10, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paroecia: <entryFree id="n33910" type="greek" key="pa^roeci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păroecĭa</orth>, <itype>and, corrupted</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">părŏchĭa</orth>,<cb n="PARR" />  <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paroiki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ecclesiastical district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum ad paroeciam Hipponensis Ecclesiae pertinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 261" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 51</bibl>, n. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla in desolatis cura dioecesibus parochiisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: tot enim Cyrus habet paroecias, Ep. Leon. 52, 4.—</sense><sense id="n33910.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the place of jurisdiction of a parish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per rusticas solitudo paroecias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit> (al. parochias).</sense></entryFree>
paroemia: <entryFree id="n33911" type="greek" key="pa^roemi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păroemĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paroimi/a</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n33911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proverb</hi>, Beda, <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> 616, 15.</sense></entryFree>
paronomasia: <entryFree id="n33912" type="greek" key="pa^ro^no^ma^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părŏnŏmăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paronomasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi> (pure Lat. agnominatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:1:3, p. 11" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 1, 3, p. 11</bibl> Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
paronychia: <entryFree id="n33913" type="greek" key="pa^ro_ny^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părōnychĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">părōny-chĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parwnuxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whitlow</hi> (pure Lat. reduvia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:163" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 9, 81, § 163</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pa ronychia et pterygia unguium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 119, § 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:88" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 24, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paropamisus: <entryFree id="n33914" type="main" key="Paro^pami_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parŏpamīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parăp-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parŏ-panīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parăp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paropa/misos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*parap-</foreign>). <sense id="n33914.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A high mountain beyond the Caspian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Hindu-Kuh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">HinduKusch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:6" default="NO">3, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 15</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33914.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parŏ-pamīsădae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parăp-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of that mountain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:6" default="NO">9, 8, 6</bibl>.—The same: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parŏpamīsii</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parăp-</orth>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33914.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Northern Asia</hi>, prob. the modern <hi rend="ital">Obi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 94</bibl> (Sillig, Parapanisus).</sense></entryFree>
paropsis: <entryFree id="n33915" type="main" key="pa^ropsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păropsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">părap-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paroyi/s</foreign> (prop. a side dish), <sense id="n33915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large square dish for the dessert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dessert-dish;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">a small dish</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parapsidem proicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paroptus: <entryFree id="n33916" type="greek" key="pa^roptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păroptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/roptos</foreign>, <sense id="n33916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roasted on the outside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly roasted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paroptus pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parorea: <entryFree id="n33917" type="main" key="Pa^ro_re_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părōrēa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părōrīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parw/reia</foreign>, <sense id="n33917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paros: <entryFree id="n33918" type="main" key="Pa^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n33918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for its white marble and as the birthplace of the poet Archilochus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Paro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreamque Paron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 465</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Olearon niveamque Paron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 126</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33918.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parian</hi>: crimine Pario accusatus, <hi rend="ital">with respect to Paros</hi> (the failure to capture Paros), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glycerae nitor Splendentis Pario marmore purius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 592</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambi,</quote> <trans><tr>of Archilochus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 23</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Paros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Parians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 31</bibl>; Nep Milt. 7, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parotis: <entryFree id="n33919" type="greek" key="pa^ro_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parwti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tumor near the ears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parotis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parotidas tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parotidas reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 48, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 15, 59, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 10, § 15</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 16</bibl>, written as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n33919.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bracket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">console</hi> of a hyperthyrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parra: <entryFree id="n33920" type="main" key="parra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a bird of ill omen, <sense id="n33920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barn owl;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the green woodpecker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the lapwing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">picus et cornix ab laevā, corvus, parra ab dexterā consuadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">impios parrae recinentis omen Ducat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 1</bibl></cit> Orell.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 292</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33921" type="main" key="Parra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
parrhasia: <entryFree id="n33922" type="main" key="Parrha^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parrhăsĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parră-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parrasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33922.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parrhăsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parrhasian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasis ursa,</quote> <trans><tr>the Great Bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasides stellae, i. e. septemtriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:577" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 577</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasis erubuit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Callisto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 460</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33922.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parrhăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasius Evander,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Carmenta</tr>, <tr>the mother of Evander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:618" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:276" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Callisto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 190</bibl></cit>: pennae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">given by Mercury</hi>, who was an Arcadian, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9</bibl>, <pb n="1306" /> <cb n="PARR" /> 660: <cit><quote lang="la">triones,</quote> <trans><tr>Charles's Wain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:58:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 58, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Parrhasium jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:25:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursa,</quote> <trans><tr>the Great Bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <trans><tr>the north pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1281" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1281</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33922.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Palatine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi> (because Evander the Arcadian settled on the Palatine Hill): <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasia domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:56:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:99:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 99, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:36:3" default="NO">8, 36, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:15:1" default="NO">12, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parrhasius: <entryFree id="n33923" type="main" key="Parrha^si^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parrhăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Parrhasia, B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33924" type="main" key="Parrha^si^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parrhăsĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Parră-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parra/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n33924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 67 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl> (4, 8), 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 34</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multos apud nos futuros Polyclitos et Parrhasios fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parrhesiastes: <entryFree id="n33925" type="greek" key="parrhe_si^astes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parrhēsĭastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parrhsiasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a free-speaker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parricida: <entryFree id="n33926" type="main" key="parri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parrĭcīda</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pārĭcīda</orth>; old collat. form of the <sense id="n33926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> PARICIDAS, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. Fest. s. v. parrici, p. 221 Müll.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>the etym. is disputed; <cit><quote lang="la">most prob. it is for patricida, from pater-caedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 35</bibl></cit></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the murderer of his</hi> or <hi rend="ital">her father</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parricide.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33926.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores supplicium in parricidas singulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte magis erit parricida, si qui consularem patrem quam si humilem necarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telegoni juga parricidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 149</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33926.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33926.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The murderer of a near relative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricida matris quoque aut fratris interfector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Virginius occisā filiā, ne se ut parricidam liberum aversarentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 5</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the murderer of his sister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:6" default="NO">3, 1, 6</bibl>; cf.: <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5</bibl>, tit. 24.—* </sense><sense id="n33926.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricida nex,</quote> <trans><tr>fratricidal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 115 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33926.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The murderer of the chief magistrate</hi> (as the father of the country); <cit><quote lang="la">of the murderers of Cæsar: si parricidae (sunt), cur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus suarum prius virtutum quam patriae parentis parricida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 21, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33926.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The murderer of a free citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a murderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assassin</hi> (syn.: sicarius, percussor): si qui hominem liberum dolo sciens morti duit, paricidas esto, Lex Numae Pompilii ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">Lex Tribunic. ap. Fest. s. v. Sacer Mons, p. 318 Müll.: parricida civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33926.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One guilty of high-treason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a traitor</hi> (qs. the murderer of his country), <hi rend="ital">a rebel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacrilegious wretch</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum sacrove commendatum qui clepserit rapseritque parricida esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: magno cum dolore parricidarum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Antony's adherents</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidae reipublicae,</quote> <trans><tr>of Catiline's associates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos de crudelissimis parricidis quid statuatis cunctamini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 31</bibl></cit>: Catilinae obstrepere omnes; <cit><quote lang="la">hostem atque parricidam vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 34, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parricidatus: <entryFree id="n33927" type="hapax" key="parri^ci_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parrĭcīdātus</orth>, <itype>ŭs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>parricida</etym>, <sense id="n33927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parricide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parricidialis: <entryFree id="n33928" type="main" key="parri^ci_di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parrĭcīdĭālis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">parrĭcīdālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">parĭc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing the crime of parricide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parricidal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">INSIDIATORES, Inscr. Boeckh. Corp. 2971: horror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 14 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">27, 1, 2: discordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: populus Judaeorum, Ambros. Cain et Abel, 1, 2, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:17:18" default="NO">17, 18</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">parrĭcīdĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">murderously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 168" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parricidium: <entryFree id="n33929" type="main" key="parri^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parrĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the murder of one's father</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parricide.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33929.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris et patrui parricidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33929.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">parricide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperare quisquam vitae parentem (philosophiam) et hoc parricidio se inquinare audet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33929.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33929.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The murder of one's mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege Pompeia de parricidiis tenetur, qui patrem, matrem, avum, aviam, fratrem, sororem, patruelem, matruelem ... patronum, patronam . . . occiderit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:288" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl>: ne <cb n="PARS" /> parricidio macularent partus suos, nepotum illi, liberūm hi progeniem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33929.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., of any horrible crime; of <hi rend="ital">the murder of a free citizen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus est vinciri civem Romani: scelus verberari: prope parricidium necari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">treason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebellion</hi> (cf. parricida, II. D.): <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidii quaestores appellabantur, qui solebant creari causā rerum capitalium quaerendarum. Nam parricida non utique is, qui parentem occidisset, dicebatur, sed qualemcumque hominem indemnatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n33929.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a name of the Ides of March</hi>, as the day when Cæsar was killed: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus Martias parricidium nominari (placuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pars: <entryFree id="n33930" type="main" key="pars"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pars</orth>, <itype>partis</itype> (<sense id="n33930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> PARTVS, Inscr. Corp. Lat. 197, 12; <case>acc.</case> partim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 46, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 36, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41, 1</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.; abl.</hi> parti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 515</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> parteis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:4:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 4, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> partum, Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 114</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root por; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/poron</foreign>, gave; <foreign lang="greek">pe/prwtai</foreign>, is given, destined; Lat. portio; cf. parare</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n33930.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne expers partis esset de nostris bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis, imperil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae partes frumenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">48: magnas partes habuit publicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare partes amicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgae pertinent ad inferiorem partem fluminis Rheni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in quattuor partes distribuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locare agrum partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars occidentalis Jordanis,</quote> <trans><tr>the west side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 23, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.2" n="2" level="3"> Magna, bona, multa, major, maxima pars, <hi rend="ital">many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a good many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the majority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pars in iis civitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major pars populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima pars hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minor pars populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa pars mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.3" n="3" level="3"> Pars, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>, partitively (= partim): <cit><quote lang="la">faciunt pars hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 36</bibl>: pars levem ducere equitum jacturam; <cit><quote lang="la">pars, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes">20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars triumphos suos ostentantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscebantque pericula, pars virtute, multi ferocia et cupidine praemiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergora deripiunt costis et viscera nudant: Pars in frusta secant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 212</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of a single person: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pars Niliacae plebis, cum verna Canopi, Crispinus ventilet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.4" n="4" level="3"> Parte, <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(poma) quae candida parte, Parte rubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melichloros est geminus, parte flavus, parte melleus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with magnā, maximā, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab semisomnis ac maximā parte inermibus refringi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">invalido exercitu et magnā parte pestilentiā absumpto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod saxum magnā parte ita proclive est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.5" n="5" level="3"> Pro parte, <hi rend="ital">for one's share</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quota</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.6" n="6" level="3"> Ex parte, <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex parte gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de decem viris sacrorum ex parte de plebe creandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n33930.7" n="b" level="4"> Ex ullā, ex aliquā, ex magnā, ex maximā parte, <hi rend="ital">in any</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullā ex parte sententia hujus interdicti infirmata sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex magnā parte tibi assentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut omnino, aut magnā ex parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucii ex magnā parte milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 56, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne minimā quidem ex parte,</quote> <trans><tr>not in the slightest degree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33930.8" n="7" level="3"> Multis partibus, <hi rend="ital">by a great deal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much</hi>: omnibus partibus, <hi rend="ital">in all respects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multis partibus malit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam numero multis partibus esset inferior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hortensii sententiam multis partibus plures ituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium virorum bonorum vitam omnibus partibus plus habere semper boni quam mali,</quote> <trans><tr>in all respects</tr>, <tr>every way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.9" n="8" level="3"> In parte, <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partly</hi> (cf. ex parte, supra): <cit><quote lang="la">in parte expeditior, in parte difficilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:34" default="NO">11, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parte verum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:13" default="NO">4, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:25" default="NO">10, 7, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.10" n="9" level="3"> Pro meā, tuā, suā parte, or simply pro parte (for the stronger pro virili<cb n="PARS" />  parte, v. virilis, II. 2.), <hi rend="ital">for my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">his share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the best of my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus aliquid opis fortasse ego pro meā, tu pro tuā, pro suā quisque parte ferre potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro meā parte adjuvi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciunt ii, qui me norunt, me pro illā tenui infirmāque parte id maxime defendisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis adest operi, plus quam pro parte laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:301" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 301</bibl></cit>.—Likewise, </sense><sense id="n33930.11" n="10" level="3"> In partem, i. q. pro parte, <foreign lang="greek">e)n me/rei</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">for one's share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the best of one's ability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi pudica mulier in partem juvet Domum (i. e. quae ad eam proprie pertinet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:39" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 39</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">age sis tuam partem nunc iam hunc delude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit> Fleck., where others read tu in partem).—</sense><sense id="n33930.12" n="11" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Acc. absol.</hi>: magnam, maximam partem, <hi rend="ital">in great part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the most part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem ex iambis nostra constat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:189" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam partem ad arma trepidantes caedes oppressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam partem lacte atque pecore vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—So, bonam partem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1249</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.13" n="12" level="3"> In eam partem. </sense><sense id="n33930.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">On that side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam partem accipio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in that sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam partem peccant, quae cautior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">On that account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with that intent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the end that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveor his rebus omnibus, sed in eam partem, ut salvi sint vobiscum omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has litteras scripsi in eam partem, ne me motum putares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.16" n="13" level="3"> In aliam partem, <hi rend="ital">in the opposite direction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antehac est habitus parcus ... is nunc in aliam partem palmam possidet,</quote> <trans><tr>for the opposite quality</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.17" n="14" level="3"> In utramque partem, <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for and against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pro and con</hi>: nullam in partem, <hi rend="ital">on neither side</hi>: in mitiorem, in optimam partem, <hi rend="ital">in the most mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">most favorable manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis est fortunae in utramque partem, vel secundas ad res, vel adversas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutram in partem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego ullam in partem disputo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitiorem in partem interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in optimam partem aliquid accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl>: in partem aliquem vocare, <hi rend="ital">to call upon one to take his share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to summon to a division</hi> of any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.18" n="15" level="3"> Nullā parte, <hi rend="ital">by no means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not at all</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.19" n="b" level="4"> Omni parte, and omni a and ex parte, <hi rend="ital">in every respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens omni parte pacata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sit omni ex parte ... perfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnique a parte placebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.20" n="16" level="3"> Per partes, <hi rend="ital">partly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod etsi per partes nonnumquam damnosum est, in summā tamen fit compendiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per partes emendare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.21" n="17" level="3"> In omnes partes, <hi rend="ital">in every respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brundusii jacere in omnes partes est molestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n33930.22" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33930.23" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">side</hi>, etc. (usu. in <number>plur.</number>; syn. factio). </sense><sense id="n33930.24" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo huic nostrae parti, quid hic respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum non liceret mihi nullius partis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a parte heredum intraverant duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ex advocatis partis adversae judex eligendus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the opposite party</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:14" default="NO">7, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:19" default="NO">12, 9, 19</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alius in aliam partem mente atque animo traheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, esp.: ex alterā parte, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ex alterā parte collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si videatis catenas, non minus profecto vos ea species moveat, quam si ex alterā parte cernatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem ex alterā parte et ancilla fecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvuli amplexi patrem tenebant. Ex alterā parte uxor maritum osculis fatigabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 114</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33930.25" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Tac.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat, inquit, illarum partium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duas partes discedunt Numidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita omnia in duas partes abstracta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi a spe, metu, partibus rei publicae animus liber erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere aliquem in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transire in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33930.26" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, on the stage: primas partes qui aget, is erit Phormio,<pb n="1307" /> <cb n="PARS" />  <hi rend="ital">the first part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the principal character</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur partes seni Poëta dederit, quae sunt adulescentium,</quote> <trans><tr>a youthful part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 1</bibl></cit>;
