<bibl default="NO">10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse primarum, secundarum, aut tertiarum partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus primarum partium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.27" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the lang. of the theatre, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">function</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, etc.—In <number>plur.</number> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sine illum priores partes hosce aliquot dies Apud me habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scribendo priores partes alicui tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero me hic sermo inducitur, ut nullae esse possent partes meae,</quote> <trans><tr>so that I could not take a part in it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiae, moderationis, temperantiae, verecundiae partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has partes lenitatis et misericordiae, quas me natura ipsa docuit semper egi libenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes accusatoris obtinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum est hoc munus, tuae partes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promitto atque confirmo, me ... imperatoris suscepturum officia atque partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii audio esse partes, ut de totā eloquentiā disserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transactis jam meis partibus ad Antonium audiendum venistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 26, 2</bibl>: ut ad partes paratus veniat, qs. <hi rend="ital">prepared to act his part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad partes parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:160" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 160</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 14, 3, 2.—In <number>sing.</number> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec igitur tibi reliqua pars est, ... ut rem publicam constituas, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars consilii pacisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videri alia quoque hujus partis atque officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:174" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars defensoris tota est posita in refutatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentiae, humilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 35</bibl></cit> et saep. (v. Bonnell, Lex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:page=627" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> p. 627</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n33930.28" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hancine ego partem capio ob pietatem praecipuam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.29" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, of food, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equiti Romano avidius vescenti partes suas misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the remains of a meal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n33930.30" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A task</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lesson</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer frugi est, decem partes dicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">46, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 625, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2872</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.31" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, of the earth.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orientis partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremis ignoti partibus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Ruhnk. on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 197</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33930.32" n="G" level="1"> In counting or calculating, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraction; one half</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one third</hi>, etc., as the context indicates: <cit><quote lang="la">tres jam copiarum partes,</quote> <trans><tr>fourths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri partes duae,</quote> <trans><tr>thirds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus partibus peditum amissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulctae novem partes,</quote> <trans><tr>tenths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.33" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">member</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam lingua mali pars pessima servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 121</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the private parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:437" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 584</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a testicle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partim</orth> (old <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">partly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33930.34" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33930.35" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: cum partim illorum saepe ad eundem morem erat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque haud scio an partim eorum fuerint, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib. 7:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: utrum neglegentia partim magistratuum, an, etc., nescio, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruttios Apulosque, partim Samnitium ac Lucanorum defecisse ad Poenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>.—So, repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora partim Multa virum terrae infodiunt avectaque partim Finitimos tollunt in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim ... partim: cum partim ejus praedae profundae libidines devorassent, partim nova quaedam et inaudita luxuries, partim etiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum autem ipsorum partim ejus modi sunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 31, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim copiarum ad tumulum expugnandum mittit, partim ipse ad arcem ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum autem, quae objecta sunt mihi, partim ea sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.36" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus partim tecum fuerunt, partim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim ex illis distracti ac dissipati jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum partim e nobis ita timidi sint, ut, etc.,... partim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dubiis partim nobis ipsis ad electionem sunt libera, partim aliorum sententiae commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.37" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so most freq.): animus partim uxoris misericordiā Devinctus, partim victus hujus injuriis, <hi rend="ital">partly</hi>,... <hi rend="ital">partly; in part</hi>,... <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 92</bibl> <cb n="PART" /> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">partim quae perspexi his oculis, partim quae accepi auribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici partim deseruerint me, partim etiam prodiderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturni silentii ... non timore aliquo, sed partim dolore, partim verecundiā, finem hodiernus dies attulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim quod ... partim quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim ductu, partim auspiciis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim cupiditate ... partim ambitione ... partim etiam inscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio dux partim factis fortibus partim suāpte fortunā quādam ingentis ad incrementa gloriae celebratus converterat animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea renuntiavit foro partim pudore, partim metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes <hi rend="ital">partim</hi> is placed only in the second member of a partitive proposition: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar a nobilissimis civibus, partim etiam a se omnibus rebus ornatis, trucidatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 158</bibl>.—Sometimes it corresponds to <hi rend="ital">alius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quidam</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum terrenae sunt aliae, partim aquatiles, aliae quasi ancipites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa inusitata partim e caelo, alia ex terrā oriebantur, quaedam etiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam placuisse mirabilia quaedam, partim fugiendas esse nimias amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra hostium invadunt, semisomnos partim, alios arma sumentes fugant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetulos accepimus, partim in tuguriis, alios incultius vagos agitare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 5</bibl></cit>; 38, 3; 40, 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33930.38" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33930.39" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">For the most part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirum quin tibi ego crederem, ut ipse idem mihi faceres, quod partim faciunt argentarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulcis obsequitor, partim quo libentius boves curent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33930.40" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. Med. 53" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. Med. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parsimonia: <entryFree id="n33931" type="main" key="parsi^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parsĭmōnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">parcĭmōnĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (collat. form, PARCIMONIVM, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 35, 4</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parco</etym>, <sense id="n33931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sparingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parsimony.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies noctesque estur, bibitur, neque quisquam parsimoniam adhibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parsimonia et duritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris conservatur diligentiā et parsimoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non intellegunt homines, quam magnum vectigal sit parsimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenti et supellectilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">veteres mores veteresque parsimoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adesto castis, Christe, parsimoniis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at the fasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine parsimoniā,</quote> <trans><tr>lavishly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sera parsimonia in fundo est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is too late to spare when all is spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">deinh\ d) e)vi\ puqme/ni feidw/</foreign>, Hesiod. <foreign lang="greek">*e)/rg</foreign>. 369).—</sense><sense id="n33931.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt pleraeque aptae hujus ipsius orationis parsimoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 84</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection).</sense></entryFree>
parsimonium: <entryFree id="n33932" type="gloss" key="parsi^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parsĭmōnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">parc-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, v. parsimonia <sense id="n33932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parstrymonia: <entryFree id="n33933" type="main" key="Parstry_mo^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parstrȳmŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tract of country on the Strymon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthaon: <entryFree id="n33934" type="main" key="Partha_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqa/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n33934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Agenor and Epicaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Calydon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Œneus</hi>: ego te simitu novi cum Parthaone, <hi rend="ital">I know you as well as I do Parthaon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not at all</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthaone nate,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Œneus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 175" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:239" default="NO">239</bibl> and 242.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33934.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthāŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Parthaon</hi>: Parthaonides dux, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Tydeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the grandson of Parthaon;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">Meleager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the brother of Tydeus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:705" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 705</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33934.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Parthaonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthaonia domus,</quote> <trans><tr>the house of Œneus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:670" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 670</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
partheni: <entryFree id="n33935" type="main" key="Parthe_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthēni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqeinoi/</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*parqinoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n33935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Dyrrhachium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33935.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenia: <entryFree id="n33936" type="main" key="Parthe^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the isle of Samos</hi>, because Juno dwelt there when a virgin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 37, § 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
partheniae: <entryFree id="n33937" type="greek" key="Parthe^ni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqeni/ai</foreign> (maidens' children), <sense id="n33937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given to the colonists of illegitimate birth who emigrated with Phalantus from Sparta and founded</hi> <cb n="PART" /> <hi rend="ital">Tarentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Parthenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl> (= spurii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 15</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
parthenianus: <entryFree id="n33938" type="main" key="Parthe^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Parthenius, V.</entryFree>
parthenias: <entryFree id="n33939" type="main" key="Parthe^ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqeni/as</foreign> (maidish). <sense id="n33939.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Virgil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of the purity of his morals</hi>, Serv. Verg. A. praef.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33939.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Tigris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenice: <entryFree id="n33940" type="greek" key="parthe^ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parthĕnĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parqenikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> parthenium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenicon: <entryFree id="n33941" type="greek" key="parthe^ni^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parthĕnĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parqeniko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> pulegium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenis: <entryFree id="n33942" type="main" key="parthe^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parthĕnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parqeni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> artemisia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 36, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenium: <entryFree id="n33943" type="greek" key="parthe^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parthĕnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">parqe/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n33943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several plants.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33943.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> perdicium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33943.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> leucanthes <hi rend="ital">or</hi> tamnacus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 30, 104, § 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33943.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> linozostis, hermupoa, <hi rend="ital">and</hi> mer curialis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33943.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> chrysocollis, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
parthenius: <entryFree id="n33944" type="main" key="Parthe^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqe/nios</foreign>. <sense id="n33944.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Arcadia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Partheni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33944.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthenii saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:285" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 285</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33944.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Paphlagonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bartan Tchai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:104" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33944.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian erotic poet and grammarian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instructor of Virgil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:26:1" default="NO">13, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33944.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A silversmith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous in the time of Juvenal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33944.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A male proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:50:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 50, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: toga, <hi rend="ital">given by Parthenius</hi>, Mart. l. l:</sense></entryFree>
parthenon: <entryFree id="n33945" type="main" key="Parthe^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqenw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated temple of Athene on the Acropolis of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Parthenon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33945.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a portico in the villa of Pomponius Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenopaeus: <entryFree id="n33946" type="main" key="Parthe^no^paeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnŏpaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqenopai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n33946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Meleager and Atalante</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven who went against Thebes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclutus armis Parthenopaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 480</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:248" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 248</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 99" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenope: <entryFree id="n33947" type="main" key="Parthe^no^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqeno/ph</foreign>, <sense id="n33947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Sirens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the departure of Ulysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threw herself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was cast up on the shore where Naples afterwards stood; on this account that city was in early times called by her name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:33" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 712</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33947.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnŏpēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Parthenope</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to Naples</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Neapolitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parthenopolis: <entryFree id="n33948" type="main" key="Parthe^no^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĕnŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqeno/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n33948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Lower Mœsia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Euxine Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33948.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parthi: <entryFree id="n33949" type="main" key="Parthi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/rqoi</foreign>, <sense id="n33949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Parthians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Scythian people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated to the north-east of the passes of the Caspian and south of Hyrcania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed in antiquity as roving warriors and skilful archers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 209</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthis mendacior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 9</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2982</bibl>.— Collect., <hi rend="ital">the Parthian</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce! fugax Parthus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versis animosus equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33949.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Parthians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:228" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:580" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:407" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 407</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33949.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*parqi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Parthians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthia</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Kohestan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 15, 17, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 350</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33949.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Par-thĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Parthians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 8, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>with the Parthians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <trans><tr>leather dyed of a scarlet-red</tr>, <tr>prepared by the Parthians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, too: cingula,</quote> <trans><tr>of Parthian leather</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: PARTHICVS as <hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Trajan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 795 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of the emperor Septimius Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 905 sq.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n33949.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĭēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for Parthia, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <pb n="1308" /> <cb n="PART" /> <hi rend="ital">country of the Parthians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthiene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:3" default="NO">6, 3, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n33949.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĭēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> Parthi, <hi rend="ital">the Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:17" default="NO">9, 10, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33949.6" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Parthian peltry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wares</hi>: negotiatores, Imp. Const. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 47, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAETOR,</quote> <trans><tr>one who had jurisdiction over the dealers in Parthian peltry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 350, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parthinus: <entryFree id="n33950" type="main" key="Parthi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthīnus</orth>, v. 3. Parthus.</entryFree>
parthus: <entryFree id="n33951" type="main" key="Parthus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Parthi, A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33952" type="main" key="Parthus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Parthian;</hi> v. Parthi.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33953" type="main" key="Parthus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Dyrrachium;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Par-thēni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Parthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Parthinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 34</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Fasti Capitol. ap. Grut. 297; Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 607. —In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parthīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n33953.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An appellation of</hi> C. Asinius Pollio, <hi rend="ital">the conqueror of the Parthinians;</hi> hence, Parthina gens, <hi rend="ital">of Asinius Pollio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33953.2" n="2" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">PARTHINVS,</quote> <trans><tr>a surname</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1186, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
partialiter: <entryFree id="n33954" type="main" key="parti^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pars</etym>, <sense id="n33954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">partly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
partianus: <entryFree id="n33955" type="main" key="Parti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Partĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a various read. for Parianus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 53, § 146</bibl>.</entryFree>
partiarius: <entryFree id="n33956" type="main" key="parti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pars</etym>, <sense id="n33956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that shares with another; shared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is shared with another</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <trans><tr>who pays his rent with a part of the produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora partiaria pascenda suscipere,</quote> <trans><tr>so that their increase is shared between the owner and the herdsman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatarius,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom a share of the property is left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:254" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:257" default="NO">257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 24, 25</bibl>: res, <hi rend="ital">that is shared with many</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33956.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> adverb.: partiario, <hi rend="ital">on shares</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcem partiario coquendam dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33956.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sharer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AGELLVLI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1004, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erroris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
partiatim: <entryFree id="n33957" type="main" key="parti^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in different parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">places</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
partibilis: <entryFree id="n33958" type="main" key="parti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divisible</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 18</bibl></cit> (al. partilis).</sense></entryFree>
particeps: <entryFree id="n33959" type="main" key="parti^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭceps</orth>, <itype>cipis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pars-capio</etym>, <sense id="n33959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participant</hi> (class.; syn.: consors, socius); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, rarely also with <case>dat.</case> or with <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33959.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n33959.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac participes nos tuae sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse participem leti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be mortal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus rationis compos et particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum omnium socius et particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 30, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes ita copulatae conexaeque sunt, ut omnes omnium participes sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae ac praemiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreti honesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33959.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem participem studiis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 41</bibl></cit> (al. studii): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus consilii fortibus viris esse participem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris in regem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Natalis particeps ad omne secretum Pisoni erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33959.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">non licet donati obsoni me participem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit> Speng.: <cit><quote lang="la">particeps in tribulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33959.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is speculatum huc misit me, ut, quae fierent, fieret particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33959.6" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a sharer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partner.</hi>—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-soldier</hi>: praeda per participes aequiter partita est, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 512, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me et semul participes meos praedā onerabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam participes petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus belli ego particeps et socius et adjutor esse cogor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quādam conjuratione quasi participes nominati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
participalis: <entryFree id="n33960" type="main" key="parti^ci^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>particeps</etym>, <sense id="n33960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participant</hi> (ante-and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit> (al. principali). —In gram., <hi rend="ital">participial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
participatio: <entryFree id="n33961" type="main" key="parti^ci^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>participo</etym>, <sense id="n33961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participation</hi> (postclass.):<cb n="PART" />  imperii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Jul. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. 83" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. 83</bibl>, n. 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
participator: <entryFree id="n33962" type="main" key="parti^ci^pa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>participo</etym>, <sense id="n33962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a participator</hi> (late Lat.), Just. Imp. Fid. Conf. ap. Agapet. Pap. Ep. 1.</sense></entryFree>
participatum: <entryFree id="n33963" type="main" key="parti^ci^pa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. participo <sense id="n33963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
participatus: <entryFree id="n33964" type="main" key="parti^ci^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>participo</etym>, <sense id="n33964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partnership</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad participatum imperii Severum vocans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pesc. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio Diadumeno in participatum ascito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
participialis: <entryFree id="n33965" type="main" key="parti^ci^pi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>participium</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n33965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the nature of a participle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so of supines and gerunds,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 808</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">822</bibl> P. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of a participle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participially</hi>, Fest. s. v. ostentum, p. 194 Müll.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> s. v. torrens, p. 352 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
participium: <entryFree id="n33966" type="main" key="parti^ci^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>particeps</etym>, <sense id="n33966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33966.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omni ad illa participio in posterum abstinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 4, 34, § 3</bibl></cit>. —Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n33966.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gram., a verbal form which partakes of the functions of a noun, <hi rend="ital">a participle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:section=110" default="NO">9, § 110</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:27" default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:47" default="NO">1, 5, 47</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
participo: <entryFree id="n33967" type="main" key="parti^ci^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (collat. <sense id="n33967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:9:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 9, § 1</bibl>) [id.], <hi rend="ital">to share;</hi> viz., <hi rend="ital">to cause to partake of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impart;</hi> and also, <hi rend="ital">to partake of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participate in</hi> (in both senses mostly ante- and post-class.; syn.: communico, partior, impertior). </sense><sense id="n33967.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make partaker of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give a share of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquaint with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make privy to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform of</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n33967.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sermone suo de amicā eri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum sui consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sint, quid agant, ecqui bene agant, Neque participant nos, neque redeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: non licet donati obsoni me participem fieri? <hi rend="ital">Ast.</hi> Si volebas participari, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti dentes sensu participentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur igitur, ad participandum alium ab alio homines naturā esse factos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33967.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: aliquid cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to share with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">suas laudes cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 26</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non participabant aliis ii, quibus aliquid affluebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">participato cum eo (fratre) regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: participato imperio, Treb. Gall. 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cum quoquam participatis nocturnis imaginibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, 9, p. 205, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33967.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To share in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partake of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participate in</hi> any thing: pestem parem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl> (Trag. v 22 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum, damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: consilium alicujus, Mamert. Grat. Act. Jul. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad participandas ejusmodi voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de uno pane,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Cor 10, 17.—With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">patrio sepulchro participans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcĭpā-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (lit. made to participate; hence), in gram., <hi rend="ital">a participle</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
particula: <entryFree id="n33968" type="main" key="parti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pars</etym>, <sense id="n33968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a particle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33968.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimae particulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne qua particula in hoc sermone praetermissa sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">particula parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique desectam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutae rerum particulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33968.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33968.3" n="A" level="2"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a clause</hi> of a sentence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:25" default="NO">4, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:6" default="NO">7, 10, 6</bibl>; 8, 3, 63; 10, 3, 30. —</sense><sense id="n33968.4" n="B" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a particle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:3" default="NO">2, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:6" default="NO">7, 7, 6</bibl>; 11, 3, 2 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
particularis: <entryFree id="n33969" type="main" key="parti^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>particula</etym>, <sense id="n33969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concerning a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">propositiones aliae universales, aliae particulares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 35, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcŭlārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 33, 32</bibl>; so opp. generaliter, Firm. Math. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. universaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
particulatim: <entryFree id="n33970" type="main" key="parti^cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part after part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit by bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one by one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si summatim, non particulatim narrabimus,</quote> <trans><tr>by particulars</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: grex particulatim facilius quam universus <cb n="PART" /> convalescit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis fundus particulatim venerit, omnes partes servitus sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 267</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. ubique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem particulatim excarnefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2 praef" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2 praef.</bibl> § 2.</sense></entryFree>
particulatio: <entryFree id="n33971" type="main" key="parti^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>particulo</etym>, <sense id="n33971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dividing into small parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pieces</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 953</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
particulo: <entryFree id="n33972" type="main" key="parti^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>particula</etym>, <sense id="n33972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participator</hi> (ante-class.). particulones dicti sunt coheredes, quod partes patrimonii sumant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 6 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
partilis: <entryFree id="n33973" type="main" key="parti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pars</etym>, <sense id="n33973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divisible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporeum omne, quod partile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 12:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemesis partilibus praesidens fatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>over the fate of individuals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">partially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea, quae fiant, non partiliter fiant, sed ad census summam redeant,</quote> <trans><tr>not in favor of a part</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
partim: <entryFree id="n33974" type="main" key="partim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partim</orth>, v. pars <sense id="n33974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
partio: <entryFree id="n33975" type="main" key="parti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pario</etym>, <sense id="n33975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing forth</hi> young (ante-and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">horresco misera, mentio quoties fit partionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:20" default="NO">12, 1, 20</bibl>.— Of hens, <hi rend="ital">a laying</hi> of eggs: <cit><quote lang="la">hae (gallinae) ad partiones sunt aptiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33976" type="main" key="parti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭi or īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭor</orth>, <itype>partītus</itype> (<sense id="n33976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. dep.</hi> partirier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 139, 8</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>pars</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part; to divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribute</hi> (Cic., Cæs., and Quint. use the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> almost exclusively in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; but the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> was employed by them also in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense; syn.: communico, participo). </sense><sense id="n33976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33976.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭo</orth>, īre: tu partem laudis caperes, tu gaudia mecum Partisses, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternabilem divitiam partissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 475:24" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 475, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona sua inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: bona testamento, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) aetheris oras Partit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules designati provincias inter se partiverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg 3, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Vangio ac Sido inter se partivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes enim, qui adhibetur ad numeros, partitur in tria, ut necesse sit partem pedis aequalem esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33976.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus</itype>, īri: <cit><quote lang="la">genus universum in species certas partietur ac dividet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum in ea, quae decuit membra partitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillis bona erepta cum eo partitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum cum Scipione honorem partitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id opus inter se Petreius atque Afranius partiuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 73</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praedam) socios partitur in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partiri limite campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum lucellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: qui numquam partitur amicum, solus habet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33976.4" n="(g)" level="5"> In a dub. form: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcemque in ambos caritatem partiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pensa inter virgines partientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—The forms partiturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4, 3</bibl>, and partiendum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl>, are to be attributed, on account of the other examples of this word in Cic. and Cæs. (v. supra), to partior.—</sense><sense id="n33976.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">shared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animi natura) partita per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio in sex partita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra partita ac distributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar partitis copiis cum C. Fabio legato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partito exercitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 24, 5: regionibus partitum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 593</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcere partitos equos,</quote> <trans><tr>parted</tr>, <tr>separated by the barriers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:680" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 680</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">partītō</orth>, adverb. <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">distributively</hi>: dividere, Reg. tit. 24, 25.—</sense><sense id="n33976.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n33976.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to share</hi> or <hi rend="ital">participate</hi> in any thing = participare: eandem me in suspitionem sceleris partivit pater, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 25</bibl> (Trag. v. 368 Vahl.).—* </sense><sense id="n33976.8" n="B" level="2"> Inter se, <hi rend="ital">to agree among themselves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos inter vos partite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with proper divisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
